loans.name: Alwal

texts.en:
Alwal Dedora is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal froom home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. Alwal is 26 years old and is married to a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of charcoal for sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Grace is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace sells food. She cooks food like fried eggplant, "ginataang langka" or jack fruit with coconut milk. After she cooks the food she puts it in cellophane and sells it in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation with the ability to engage in business. Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the food she cooks. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for food she cooks for sale

To make a living, Carmen operates a specialized retail store and her main source of income from the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation with the ability to engage in business. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo S. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 50 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Ricardo owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) in the local community. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia NORBERTA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos; dos mujeres y un varón,los mayores trabajan y el menor estudia en la universidad. Ella es ama de casa y se dedica atender a su hijo menor.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el cuidado de sus nietos. La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer arreglos en su casa y seguir educando a su hijo. Ella quiere compran más materiales para terminar de construir su casa y tambien comprar libros para la preparación de su hijo en la universidad.          
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norberta is a member of the Communal Bank named “Minibank”. She is a native of the city of Cusco. Norberta is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children, two daughters and a son. The two older children are working, while the youngest one is studying at the university. Norberta is a housewife who takes care of her youngest child.

She divides her time between her household activities and looking after her grandchildren. Norberta is requesting a loan to perform some remodeling jobs around her house and to pay for her child’s education expenses. She wants to buy more materials to finish the remodeling jobs in her house and also purchase books for her child’s university classes.

Norberta is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish remodeling jobs & pay for the books needed for her child's college classes

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
El socio RIMBER pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 6 meses de nacida. 

El tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes y turismo que brinda servicios turísticos que le ofrece la ciudad Imperial Cusco como el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc.   

EL requiere el préstamo para implementar su equipo de viajes como equipos de camping, carpas, menajeria (utensilios de cocina) para los turistas que llegan a la ciudad del Imperial del Cusco. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rimber is a member of the Communal Bank named “Minibank”. He is a native of the city of Cusco. Rimber is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 6 month old daughter.

He manages a small travel and tourism agency that provides tourist services. These include tours of various sites around the Imperial City of Cusco such as the Sacred Valley of the Incas, Machu Picchu, Salkantay, etc.

Rimber is requesting a loan to purchase items to start a travel group such as camping equipment, tents, and cooking utensils for tourists who visit Cusco. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase camping equipment for tour groups

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda es una madre D. familia D. 53 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, uno D. los cuales es especial, en el distrito D. Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria D. una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado usado en el transporte D. carga y pasajeros) por la cual percibe un ingreso económico que le ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo sufrió un accidente en su lugar D. trabajo y quedó inválido D. una pierna. 

La mototaxi es trabajada todo el día por uno D. sus hijos. El contínuo uso D. su vehículo ha hecho que experimente fallas mecánicas que requieren urgente reparación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es reunir el dinero suficiente para adquirir otra mototaxi, para obtener más ingresos económicos que sustenten a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y que siempre está al pendiente D. los suyos.
texts.en:
Arminda is a 53 year old mother who lives with her husband and 4 children in the District of Cayaltí, located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She owns a motorcycle taxi (used for transporting cargo and passengers). The income she receives is used to cover her household expenses since her husband suffered an accident at work and lost the use of one of his legs.

One of her children operates the motorcycle taxi for the entire day. The continued use of the vehicle has resulted in mechanical failures that require urgent repairs. Due to this need, Arminda requested her first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to raise enough money to purchase another motorcycle taxi so that she can generate more income to maintain her family. She is a very responsible woman who is always thoughtful of others.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair & maintenance of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.es:
La socia ANGELICA SUSANA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 50 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos un varón y dos mujeres. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de víveres. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital y poder vender más víveres como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en tarro, aceite, etc.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Angelica Susana is a member of the Communal Bank named “Minibank”. She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 50 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children (one son and two daughters). Angelica operates a small grocery store. She divides her time between her household activities and selling basic necessities. Angelica is requesting a loan to increase her capital so that she can buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, etc. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: María Marina

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, todos en edad escolar, en el caserío Corral de Palos, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 20 años en su domicilio. Usualmente cría cerdos, pavos, patos y gallinas, los cuales vende en el mercado de Cayaltí los días martes, pero la mayoría de veces es visitada por sus clientes en su domicilio debido a los bajos precios que ofrece.

Ella nos cuenta que empezó con esta actividad debido a que su esposo es peón agrícola y lo que percibía no era suficiente para solventar los gastos del hogar. María está pensando en mejorar la calidad de alimentación de sus animales por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Su sueño es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad y verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales. María es empeñosa, responsable y muy carismática.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children who are of school age. She and her husband live in the village of Corral de Palos, District of Cayaltí, which is located an hour and 10 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been raising animals at her home for more than 20 years. María usually raises pigs, turkeys, ducks, and chickens and then sells the animals at the Cayaltí Market on Tuesdays. Most of the time her customers come to her home because she charges a lower price.

María says she started her business because her husband did not earn enough money at his job as a farm laborer to cover the household expenses. She wants to improve the quality of her animals’ diet so she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles. The proceeds will be used to purchase nutritious feed.

Her dream is to provide her children with a quality education in hopes of seeing them become successful professionals. María is determined, responsible, and charismatic.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quality feed for her animals

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La socia YAQUELINE pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 6 meses de nacida. 

Ella tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes y turismo que brinda servicios turísticos que ofrece la ciudad Imperial del Cusco como el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc.   

Ella requiere el préstamo para implementar sus equipos de viajes como equipos de camping, carpas, menajeria (utensilios de cocina) para brindar mejor los servicios para los turistas que llegan a la ciudad del Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaqueline belongs to Minibank community bank. She is from Cusco. She is 27 years old and has a 6-month old daughter with her live-in partner. Yaqueline has a small travel agency that provides tourism services from Cusco, such as the Sacred Valley of the Incans, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc. She needs a loan to obtain travel equipment, such as camping gear, tents, and cooking utensils, in order to provide better service to the tourists that arrive in the imperial city of Cusco. She is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to repaying the loan as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional travel gear.

loans.name: Claritza

texts.es:
Claritza tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad en casa de su madre ubicada en Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis meses se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares. Además ayuda a su madre en su negocio de venta de comida desde hace cuatro años.

En esta campaña navideña María tiene pensado dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pero aún no cuenta con el capital suficiente para empezar este negocio, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hija convertida en una profesional para que empiece a valerse por si misma. Ella es una madre luchadora, trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Claritza is a 34-year old single mother. She lives with her 14-year old daughter in her mother's house in Cayaltí, which is 1 hour outside the city of Chiclayo. She has been making catalog sales of beauty products for 6 months and her main customers are neighbors and family. She has also helped her mother with her business selling food for 4 years. This Christmas season she is thinking of selling clothing, but does not have enough capital to start the business. Thus, she has seen it necessary to request a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. Her greatest wish is to see her daughter become a professional so that she can take care of herself. Claritza is a fighter and a hard worker, who knows how to make it despite setbacks.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
El socio CESAR ANTONIO pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero. El estudia la carrera profesional de turismo y trabaja como chofer.  

El tiene un carro(taxi), el hace el servicio de transporte trasladando pasajeros al Valle Sagrado de los Incas; Pisac, Ollaytaytambo, Calca, Urubamba, Lamay, etc. EL requiere el préstamo para implementar su carro, gastos personales y para el estudio.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cesar Antonio is a member of the “Minibank” communal bank, and is a native of Cusco. He is 26 years old and is single. He is studying the tourism profession and works as a taxi driver.

Cesar has his own taxi and provides passenger service to the “Sacred Valley of the Incas,” including Pisac, Ollaytaytambo, Calca, Urubamba, Lamay, etc.

Cesar is seeking a loan for maintenance of his taxi, personal expenses, and the cost of his studies. He is grateful for this opportunity and commits himself to completing his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Studies, personal expenses, and car maintenance

loans.name: Aurora Luisa

texts.es:
Aurora es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de  12 años en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año tiene una bodega funcionando en su casa en donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas gaseosas. Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer de vehículos de carga y con lo que ambos ganan tratan de sacar adelante a su famlia.

Por la campaña navideña Aurora tiene planeado ampliar su negocio con la compra de panetones y champagne, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad e instalar un puesto de venta de calzado en el mercado de su distrito. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Aurora is a 49 year old mother. She lives with her husband and 12 year old son in the Cayaltí district, which is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a store in her house for one year. She sells basic needs items, groceries, and soft drinks. Her husband works occasionally as a cargo driver. They try to get their family ahead with what they both earn. Aurora plans to increase her business for the Christmas season by purchasing “panetones” (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple) and champagne. That is why she sees the need to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN. Her dream is to give her son a quality education and to set up a place selling footwear in the market in her district. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated that she is a client who is responsible about her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy "panetones" (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple) and champagne for the Christmas season

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Y. Umanzor tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, pero ahora desea comprar mercaderia nueva como cosmeticos y perfumes.
tiene su negocio desde hace 17 años y opera bajo el nombre de bodeguita conchita , y esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome, doña conchita como es conocida en su centro de trabajo y en su domicilio de la colonia rotaria es una persona muy querida y muy respetada 
por su deseo de superacion y amabilidad, Conchita esta solicitando el credito para comprar productos nuevos y poder aumentar su inventario ya que con sus ganancias mantiene su hogar.
texts.en:
Concepcion Y. Umanzor is 58 and has five children. They are all grown. She sells food products, but she now wants to buy new merchandise like cosmetics and perfumes. She has had her business for 17 years. It is called “Bodequita Conchita”, and it is located inside the municipal market in the city of Nacaoma. Conchita, as she is known in her work center and her home in the Rotaria neighborhood, is a much loved and much respected person for her desire to succeed and her kindness. Conchita is asking for a loan to buy new products to be able to increase her inventory. Her earnings support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, and hair conditioners

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: La señora Meri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella  y son su impulso, para seguir adelante.Meri, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. Meri, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Meri, 48, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank, Sacanche district, Huallaga Province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of 3 children, two of whom still depend on her and are the motivating force for her to continue forward. Meri is an efficient woman who, needing to produce her own income, started to run a grocery store in her home. She started small and little by little has been improving and has a more varied inventory available for her customers and housewives who find what they need here. Currently, she runs the same business and she tells us that she does quite well. With this 1,000 sol loan, she intends to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, milk, preserved fish in boxes and of various brands, household cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items, packages of soft-drinks in various flavors and brands in order to better satisfy and offer better service to her customers. Meri is very satisfied with what she has accomplished. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and to have her dreams and goals become realities as well as other women who want to grow in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her popsicles.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, dos de los cuales estudian, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace un año. Cuando llegan al peso adecuado ella los ofrece en venta en el mercado de su distrito. Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer de carga y lo que percibe no es suficiente para afrontar los gastos del hogar. Por este motivo ella da todo de sí para sacar adelante su negocio y apoyar a la economía de su hogar.

María quiere brindar a sus animales una alimentación de calidad, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es tener un espacio habilitado para la buena crianza de sus cerdos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and 4 children, two of whom are in school. They live in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked raising pigs for a year. When they weigh enough she offers them for sale at the market in her district. Her husband is a deliveryman and realizes that this is not enough to meet the household expenses. For this reason she gives all of herself to push her business forward and to support the household finances. Maria wants to provide to her animals good quality food, and for this reason she is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to invest in buying nutritious feed for the pigs. Her greatest dream is to have a space properly fitted-out for raising the pigs. She is a hard-working mother, and is responsible and very dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed for pigs

loans.name: Betsaida Rosaly

texts.es:
la señora Betzaida Rosaly C. B. tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Hace 2 años se dejo con su esposo de nacionalidad mexicana, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros atuendos. Su casa de habitacion le fue heredada por su padre, el negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de Nacaome y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 7 años, la cual le a ayudado a salir adelante con su familia,
su deseo es que su negocio sea una tienda y poder dar un buen estudio a sus hijos hasta convertirlos en profesionales, esta solicitando el credito para surtir de mercaderia su negocio y asi aprovechar la temporada navideña para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betzaida Rosaly C. B. is 30 years old, is a single mother of 3 children. It has been two years since her husband, a Mexican national, left. She works selling clothes, shoes and other clothing. She inherited the home where she lives from her father. The business is located within the municipal market of Nacaome and she has worked in this activity for 7 years, which has helped her to get ahead for her family. She wants her business to be a shop and to be able to give her children a good opportunity to study to become professionals. She is asking for a loan to build inventory to have for the holiday season to make more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy children's and women's underwear, bras, skirts and blouses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos de 14 y 15 años en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de chupetes (paletas de hielo con sabor a frutas) en la plaza de armas de su distrito. También trabaja haciendo limpieza en un banco de la zona. Hace algunos años su esposa tuvo que viajar al extranjero por motivos de trabajo para poder ayudar a sustentar a la familia. Desde ese entonces Juan está encargado de la crianza y cuidado de sus hijos.

Debido a la proximidad del verano, los días son más calurosos y la gente recurre con más frecuencia a su negocio. Debido al continuo uso, su congeladora hace poco sufrió algunas fallas que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es poder apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y reunirse pronto con su esposa. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente demostrando responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juan is a 33-year-old family man who lives together with his two children, 14 and 15 years of age, in the district of Cayalti, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked for 10 years selling popsicles in the main plaza of his district. He also does cleaning in a local bank. A few years ago his wife had to travel out of the country for work-related reasons in order to help support the family. Since then Juan has been in charge of raising and caring for his children. Due to the proximity of summer, the days are hotter and people come to his business more frequently. Because of the continuous use, not long ago his freezer began to malfunction and is in urgent need of repair. This is why he is requesting a credit of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. His dream to be able to support children in their education and to reunite soon with his wife. He has worked with our institution previously, demonstrating responsibility when it came time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the expenses of repairing his freezer

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
La socia María, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia cada sábado muy temprano por la mañana lleva una serie de artículos reciclados por ella durante toda la semana el mercado de pulgas llamado baratillo, ella lleva desde clavos pequeños, hasta alfombras, cubiertos libros, y todo lo que pueda vender como repuesto de algún artefacto o simplemente como objeto de segunda mano o segundo uso, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de algunos materiales de hierro o plástico para revenderlos.

Ella hace esto desde hace  20 años.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Maria, belongs to the bank "ALLIN MUJU", located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. She is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children. She alternates her various household chores with her business. Every Saturday, very early in the morning, she takes a variety of items that she has recycled throughout the week to a flea market called Baratillo. She takes everything from small pins to rugs, books, and anything she can sell as a spare for something, or simply as a second-hand object. Our partner is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of some iron and plastic materials to then resell them. She has been doing this for 20 years. She is grateful for and values the loan granted to her through this medium, and likewise is committed to fulfill her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase iron and plastic materials for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia vende muebles de madera y ferretería en el segundo paradero de san Sebastián; el esposo de nuestra socia es carpintero y ella vende todos los fines de semana en esta feria los muebles que su esposo hace, desde sillas, camas, armarios, roperos, mesas, cómodas, veladores y mucho mas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar madera al por mayor y así seguir fabricando muebles y trabajando juntos por el bien de su familia.


Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Yolanda, belongs to the bank "ALLIN MUJU", located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her various household chores with her business, selling wooden furniture and hardware at the second stop in San Sebastian. Her husband is a carpenter, and every weekend at this fair she sells the furniture that he makes, including chairs, beds, wardrobe closets, tables, dressers, night stands, and much more. Our partner is requesting this loan to be able to buy wood wholesale and thereby continue making furniture and working together with her husband for the good of their family. She is thankful for and values the loan granted through this medium, and likewise is committed to fulfilling her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood wholesale

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: La señora Meri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”,  Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años y 03 hijos,  01 que aun depende de ella. Meri, lleva 10 años dedicándose al negocio, motivada por ella misma y buscando alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Meri, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Meri, 53, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Huallaga province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children, one of which still depends on her. For the past 10 years, self-motivated and seeking ways to generate income and thanks to her hard-working and enterprising nature, she began to sell home-made popsicles. She tells us that she is doing quite well and little by little has grown her customer base. Currently, she continues with the same business because her customers realize that the product she offers is very well received and, above all, that they are treated with kindness, which is her trait. With this 3,000 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her product preparation like sacks of sugar, boxes of milk and fruits which are needed daily for her popsicle production. Every day she counts on the variety of her products to capture more customers. Meri feels very strong to continue to work and perservering day to day. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy ingredients to prepare her popsicles.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia Lourdes, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, nuestra socia vende todo tipo de productos tanto de primera necesidad como insumos diversos para elaborar muchos productos alimenticios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y adquirir mayor mercadería, de este modo estará mas abastecido su negocio y por lo tanto venderá mas. 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the bank, “ALLIN MUJU”. This bank is located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. This member is 34 years old, she is in a domestic partnership and has 2 children. She alternates her many activities of the home with those of her business. She sells all kind of products such as basic necessities for the preparation of various dishes. She is asking for a loan to set up her business and acquire more goods to supply the business and be able to increase sales. She appreciates and values loans awarded in this way and in the same manner commits to complying with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to set up her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: personal use

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y tres de sus cuatro hijos en el anexo La Otra Banda, distrito de Zaña, ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años tiene una bodega en su casa donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas. Ella nos comenta que la idea de su negocio nació ante la necesidad de apoyar en la economía de su hogar ya que el sueldo que percibe su esposo como obrero de la cooperativa agrícola de la zona no es suficiente para mantenerlos.

La contínua demanda de sus clientes por más productos ha hecho que Domitila piense en ampliar su negocio por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean exitosos en el futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Domitila is 44 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three of her four children in the annex, La Otra Banda, in the Zaña district, located one hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, she has operated a shop in her house where she offers basic necessities, groceries and candies. She has told us that the idea of her business was born from the need to support her family economically since her husband's wage as a worker for the agricultural co-op in their area wasn't sufficient to support them. The continued demand from her customers for more products has made Domitila think about expanding her business for which she has seen the need to request a loan of 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Her dream is to be able to provide her children with a good education so that they may be successful in the future. She has already worked with our institution and has demonstrated that she is a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products and groceries to expand her business.

loans.name: Melissa Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Melissa, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años de edad, ella es soltera, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades con el trabajo de limpieza en una agencia de viajes, ella va a hacer la limpieza general de esta empresa y sus sucursales, nuestra socia también desea estudiar turismo, por lo que solicita el préstamo para su primer pago del curso 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Melissa belongs to the Allin Muju communal bank, which is in the city of Cuscu in the Huanchac district. She is 27 and single. She alternates her diverse activities. She does cleaning work for a travel agency. She is going to do general cleaning for this business and its branches. She also wants to study tourism. That is why she is asking for the loan; it is for the first payment of the course. She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this medium. By the same token, she promises to make all of her payments on the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for an educational course

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: La señora Dina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito D. Sacanche, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D.  02 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella. Motivada por ella misma emprendió un pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, hace 05 años atrás y con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 se implemento mucho mas obteniendo buenos resultados desD. un inicio, por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.Se siente una Mujer fuerte, con ganas D. salir adelante aun y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children of whom one is still a dependent.

Five years ago, Dina was motivated to start a small business selling groceries. She received her first loan of 300 soles to start her business. Dina achieved good results from the beginning as a result of the quality of her products, low prices, and providing good service to her customers. She continues to manage her business from home to this very day. Her main customers are neighbors from the area.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will purchase more products to restock her business such as rice and sugar by the kilo, crates of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies, sodas by the pack, sweets, and other items to keep her customers happy. Dina feels she is a strong woman capable of moving forward. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue working for a long time and help other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
El socio Cayetano, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socio tiene 65 años de edad, el es viudo y tiene 4 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus actividades cotidianas con la mecánica, el actualmente solo asesora el trabajo de sus hijos que le heredaron el arte de los fieros, nos manifiesta que eles enseño todo a sus hijos y que ellos ahora saben mucho y que continuaron la labor que el hace años comenzó, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunas maquinas de pulir para los autos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cayetano belongs to the “ALLIN MUJU” bank, which is located in the Huanchac district in the city of Cusco. Cayetano is 65 years old and is a widower with 4 children. He alternates his daily activities with work as a mechanic. He is currently teaching his children the art of metalworking, since they will inherit his business. He tells us that he has taught his children everything and that they now know a great deal and are continuing the work that he began many years ago. Cayetano is requesting a loan so that he can purchase some buffing machines for cars. Cayetano appreciates the loan that is being offered here and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing buffing machines for cars

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia Luzmila, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas y también está dedicada a la repostería, nuestra socia vende todo tipo de postres y elabora tortas, bocaditos y mucho mas para las diferentes ocasiones. Desde hace 13 años. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para elaborar desde la maza y los ingredientes de sus postres.


Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Luzmila belongs to the bank “ALLIN MUJU”, located in the city of Cusco, in the Huanchac District. She is 47, married, with 3 children. She alternates her home activities with retail work. She makes all kinds of clothing and also does baking. Our member has been selling many types of desserts and fancy cakes, snacks and much more for all different occasions for the past 13 years. Luzmila is requesting a loan to buy supplies for baking, such as maza (basis for cornmeal products) and ingredients for her desserts. Our member appreciates and values the loan that she will receive and also promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Luis O. tiene 49 años de edad y es padre de 5 hijos, todos ellos adultos, se dedica a la comercializacion de adobes, ladrillos y tejas, tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad.
su negocio le a ayudado a salir adelante y a mantener su familia.
ahora necesita capital para comprar mas ladrillos y tejas ya esta vendiendo su producto en diferentes lugares y lo que compra no le ajusta ya que la demanda es buena, por tal razon necesita el credito.
el carro en que transporta el material de construccion es de el.
nos comento que se siente mu feliz ya que sus ganancias han aumentado y le esta dando una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santos Luis O., 49, has five children. They are all adults. He sells adobe bricks, bricks, and tiles. He has been doing this for ten years. His business has helped him get ahead and support his family. He now needs capital to buy more bricks and tiles. He is selling his products in different places. What he buys is not enough because the demand is good. That is the reason he needs the loan. The car that he uses to transport the construction materials is his. He tells us that he feels very happy that his earnings have increased. It is giving his wife a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy adobe bricks, bricks, and tiles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zenith

texts.es: La señora Zenith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Zenith, es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a la venta de combustible, hace tres años a tras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace. En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 50 cilindros de combustible cada quincena como; kerosene, gasolina y petróleo.Zenith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Zenith is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Zenith is a strong-willed woman who has been selling fuel for three years. She has not had any difficulty succeeding in her work and says that she is happy with what she has achieved. Her customers know her well and come by her vending post daily to buy her products. Zenith welcomes them personally with her charming personality.

With this loan of 3000 soles, Zenith will purchase 50 cylinders of fuel every two weeks. These products include kerosene, gasoline, and petroleum. She is a very accomplished woman today and is eager to continue forward as long as God provides her the strength. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barrels of fuel

loans.name: Danny Adriel

texts.es:
El socio Danny, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestro socio tiene 32 años de edad, el convive con su novia y están en la espera de un hijo pronto, nuestro socio es administrador y solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un mueble para su hogar.


Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Member Danny belongs to the Allin Muju bank. This bank can be found in the city of Cusco, in the district of Huanchac. Our member is 32 years old. He lives with his fiance and they are expecting a baby soon. Our member is an administrator and he is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of furniture for his home. Danny is thankful for and values the loan granted to him in this manner. At the same time, he promises to make his payments at the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use.

loans.name: Esmila

texts.es: La señora Esmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre de 5 hijos, todos ya independientes.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva ya 15 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Esmila, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Esmila, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmila s a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother 5 children who are all independent.

Wanting to see her children become professionals capable of earning their own incomes, Esmila decided to start a business. She tells us that she experienced a lot of highs and lows in her life, but the enterprising spirit she has always possessed enabled her to succeed. Esmila started her business selling prepared foods 15 years ago. She sells her meals out of her home, which is equipped for accommodating patrons. Gradually she became well-known among her customers, which consists of neighbors, friends, and relatives. She offers meals in the mornings and afternoons, and her sales have done very well.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Esmila will purchase supplies for her prepared meals such as sacks of rice and sugar, chicken, crates of eggs, bananas by the bunch, packets of noodles and oil by the dozen, as well as cooking utensils. These items will enable her to provide quality service. Esmila still feels she can put in the effort required to continue selling food. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio Guido, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestro socio tiene 18 años de edad, el está conviviendo con su novia, y tienen un hijo, nuestro socio es cobrador de servicios de transporte urbano, el trabaja en Cusco de boletero, el socio el préstamo para poder invertir en sus estudios


Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Member Guido belongs to the Allin Muju bank. This bank can be found in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. Our member is 18 years old. He lives with his fiance and they have one child. Our member is a collector for urban transport services. He works in Cusco as a cashier. He will use to loan to invest in his education. Our member is thankful for and values the loan granted to him in this manner. At the same time, he promises to make his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his education.

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
la sra. Martires G. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en Jicaro Galan, este es un lugar en el cual se cruza la carretera panamericana que viene de la frontera con El Salvador y la otra de la frontera con Nicaragua, este lugar es muy transitado.
gracias a ello en su negocio compran muchas personas.
Martires se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende varios productos.
ahorita necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son bastantes y a veces se queda sin producto.
texts.en:
Martires G. is 43 years old. She lives in Jicaro Galan. This is a place where the PanAmerican Highway crosses coming from the border with El Salvador and in the other direction the border with Nicaragua. This is a place that is well traveled. Thanks to this, many people buy from her business. Martires is dedicated to selling popular consumer goods. She has a shop in which she sells various items. Right now, she needs a loan to be able to stock her business with more since her customers' demands are large and sometimes she lacks products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sardines, milk, cheese, soups, pastas, mustard, mayonnaise, tomato sauce, instant soups, sodas, churros, rice, sugar, cookies, butter, oil, beans, soap, candles, matches, spices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase holiday season products.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe R. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual fue para poder la losa en un cuarto trasero el cual es la recamara de sus hijos.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio que tiene el y su esposa la señora María Estela R., ya que en la compañía que estaba trabajando recortaron personal. 
Tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de comida. El negocio está ubicado afuera de su casa para atender a los niños. Quieren tener otro corrito de ventas de comida en otro ubicación igual de transitada  y que lo atienda el señor Felipe. Es por eso que están solicitando este préstamo, para la inversión de un nuevo negocio.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias D. negocio, ya con el otro local de comida será para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Felipe R. is thankful for the cooperation with his previous loan which went towards laying a slab in the back room which is his children's bedroom. Again, he is requesting a loan to invest in his business which he and his wife, María Estela R., own since the company he was working for had layoffs. He already has more than four years experience selling food. The business is located outside their home so they may attend to their children. They want to have another cart for selling food in another location that is as well-traveled, which Felipe can attend. It is for this that they are requesting this loan, to invest in a new business. They plan to pay the loan with the income from their business since the other food business can cover their family's bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a cart for selling food.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia A. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en sus dos créditos que ha tenido con Kiva los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mercancías ya que tiene muy poca y quiere que su negocio este bien surtido ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Hortencia A. is very grateful for your cooperation with the two loans that she has had with Kiva, which she has paid back punctually. She is asking for another loan to invest in merchandise. She now has very little, and she wants her business to be well stocked. It is the source of income for her family. She plans on paying the loan with part of the earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Etna Azucena

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa del Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por su artesanos que elaboran los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla muy conocidos en el mundo entero, por sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias.

La señora  Etna Azucena P. es una socia activa del banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio, ella es  una profesora  jubilada, vive con su hija y cuatro nietos, a sus 80 años de edad se dedica a las manualidades hace flores en tela, borda con hilo y lana, y lo más interesante que aún le queda tiempo para vender mercadería y participar en  el coro del magisterio que ya  han grabado un disco.

Etna Azucena es muy trabajadora  su hermana que vive en los Estados Unidos  le incursionó en las ventas de  batas de dormir elaboradas en seda y con finos bordados a sus amigas y ex  compañeras de su localidad, cada bata cuesta 28 dólares a crédito (dos pagos)
 
Nuestra socia está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá en la  compra   de pantalones jeans, blusas, camisas, sacos, interiores, calcetines, carteras zapatos  para damas, caballeros y niños para tener un surtido completo  para la época navideña.
texts.en:
The Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi district of the pretty and productive province on Manabí in the coastal region of Ecuador. This region is characterized by craftsmen who make the famous straw hats known throughout the whole world, its typical dishes, the natural beauty, and the kindness of the people. The bank was formed by enterprising women looking for a better quality of life with their families. Etna Azucena P. is an active member of the Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Communal Bank. She is a retired teacher. She lives with her daughter and her four grandchildren. At her 80 years of age, she makes handicrafts like flowers in material, and she embroiders with thread and wool. It is so interesting that she still has time to sell her merchandise and participate in the teachers’ chorus, which has already recorded a record. Etna Azucena is very hard-working. Her sister, who lives in the United States, got her involved in selling silk bathrobes with fine embroidery to her friends and former colleagues from the area. Each robe costs two payments of $28 each. Our member is asking for a new loan to buy jeans, blouses, shirts, jackets, underwear, socks, purses, and shoes for women, men, and children. She wants to be completely stocked for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, jeans, blouses, shirts, socks, underwear, and purses

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: La señora Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene  37 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.Paquita,  nos cuenta que en su vida paso por muchas dificultades, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva ya 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Paquita, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Paquita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Paquita, 37, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and her son, who is a student and still dependent upon her. Paquita relates that her life has passed through many difficulties but the enterprising spirit that has always charaterized her and her desire to get ahead in life, have served to inspire her to start her own business selling prepared meals and she has been involved in this occupation for 5 years now. Paquita sells her meals in her own house, a space that's well equipped to serve her customers. Little by little se became better known among her customers, who are her neighbors, friends and family members, for the good flavor of her meals and her sales are good. She offers meals twice a day: mornings and afternoons. With this 3,000 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her meals like: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens, flats of eggs, bunches of bananas, pastas and oil by the dozen as well as kitchen utensils to provide better quality service. Paquita, like she is refered to affectionately, feels empowered to continue with her food sales. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her reaching her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad D. Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas y pasteles. Nos cuenta que esta actividad le gustaba desD. que era pequeña y que se valió D. ella para apoyar a la economía D. su hogar mientras vivía en Bagua (una ciudad D. la selva peruana) junto a su esposo, que es policía.

Hace cinco años su esposo fue cambiado a la ciudad D. Lambayeque y desD. entonces tuvo que impulsar su negocio desD. cero: empezó regalando pequeñas muestras D. pastel en Instituciones y Colegios D. la ciudad y poco a poco obtuvo sus primeros pedidos. Entonces su negocio fue creciendo D. nuevo gracias a la buena sazón y paciencia con las que prepara sus pasteles.

Actualmente no sólo brinda servicios D. preparación D. pasteles sino que también elabora buffettes completos para ceremonias especiales. Poco a poco ha podido comprar los materiales que necesita para seguir trabajando con su negocio pero aún le faltan las mesas que sostienen a los pasteles durante las ceremonias.

Este negocio le ayuda a colaborar con el sostenimiento D. su familia, pero lo que percibe no le basta para comprar los materiales que necesita. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es tener su casa propia e instalar una panadería. Ella es una madre trabajadora y creativa.
texts.en:
Estela is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes cakes and pastries. Estela says she enjoyed baking as a little girl and started to utilize her skills to support her family when she lived in Bagua (a city in the Peruvian jungle) with her husband, who is a policeman.

Five years ago, her husband was transferred to the city of Lambayeque so she had to start her business over from scratch. She began giving away small pastry samples at institutions and schools within the city. As a result, she received her first orders. Her business started to grow again thanks to the great care and patience by which she prepares her cakes.

In addition to baking, Estela also prepares complete buffets for special ceremonies. She wants to gradually purchase all the supplies she needs to continue working in this line of business, but at the moment, she lacks tables used for displaying cakes during a ceremony.

Estela’s business enables her to support her family, but she does not generate enough revenue to buy the materials she needs. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles. Estela dreams of owning a home and opening her own bakery. She is a hardworking mother and a creative woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables for displaying cakes & pastries

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres D. Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa D. Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por sus artesanos que elaboran los tan famosos sombreros de paja toquilla tan conocidos en el mundo entero, sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. 

Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias, es así como  nos pusimos en contacto con la socia Lorena Elizabeth D. S., madre soltera de dos niños comparte sus actividades entre los quehaceres D. hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y su labor como comerciante,  compra y vende mercadería como prendas de vestir, ropa casual, deportiva e interiores para damas caballeros y niños,  cosméticos Yanbal, etc. esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en la misma localidad donde vive, para poder vender facilita a sus clientes la forma de pago cobrando por semana o quincena así los clientes quedan satisfechos.

Lorena esta preparándose para ser una profesional, ha empezado a estudiar en la Universidad de Manta la especialidad en Servicios Gerenciales,   en su  tiempo de trabajo y estudio su madre le ayuda con el cuidado de los niños ya que viven junto a ellos  todavía, manifiesta  que no ha sido nada fácil enfrentarse en la vida con dos pequeños  pero ellos son su inspiración para salir a trabajar todos los días.

Nuestra socia Lorena está solicitando un préstamo a la Fundación Espoir con la cual ha venido trabajando desde hace  tres ciclos y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en su negocio, ahora comprará mercadería surtida como pantalones jeans, camisas, blusas, interiores, etc. para damas caballeros y niños para la época de  navidad y para entregar algunos pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.

El sueño de Lorena es ponerse una tienda grande de ropa para seguir manteniendo a sus hijos y cubrir sus gastos de estudios.
texts.en:
The Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi division of the beautiful and bountiful province of Manabí, located in Ecuador’s coastal region. This area is known for its handicrafts (the best straw hats in the world), traditional dishes, natural beauty, and friendly people.

This Communal Bank consists of enterprising women who are looking to provide their families with a better quality of life. One of these women is Lorena Elizabeth D. S., a single mother of two children. She divides her time among her household chores, looking after children, and her work as a retailer. Lorena buys and sells merchandise such as dress clothes, casual wear, sportswear, and undergarments for women, men, and children. In addition, she offers Yanbal cosmetics. She sells her products as a traveling merchant in the neighborhood where she lives. To keep her customers happy, she allows them to pay her on a weekly or biweekly schedule.

Lorena is preparing to become a professional. She started her studies at the University of Manta for a degree in Management Services. When she has to work or study, Lorena’s mother looks after her children since they already live together. Lorena says living with two small children is not easy, but they provide the inspiration for her to go to work every day.

Lorena is requesting another loan from Fundación ESPOIR. She worked on three previous loan cycles and used the proceeds to invest in her business. With this loan, she plans to buy merchandise to add to her inventory such as jeans, shirts, blouses, underwear, and other items for women, men, and children. This will allow her to be prepared for the Christmas season and fulfill some of her outstanding customer orders.

She dreams of opening a large clothing store so that she can continue supporting her children and cover her educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María R. y su esposa el señor Manuel Paz, están muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual les ayudo mucho a su negocio y obtener un ingreso más a su familia.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes se los están pidiendo. 
Planean pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de uno de los locales y el otro ingreso será para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana María R. and her husband, Sr. Manuel Paz, are extremely grateful for the assistance they received through their previous loan. This helped them tremendously with their business and in obtaining more income for their family.

Sra. Ana María is requesting another loan to invest in winter merchandise because her customers are requesting these products. She plans to repay the loan using the revenue she generates from one her vending locations. The rest of the money she earns is dedicated to family expenses. (Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Liliana Agustina

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa del Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por la elaboración de artesanías sobre todo se tejen los mejores sombreros de paja toquilla  del mundo, sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias.

La señora Liliana  P. es socia del  banco comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio, vive en el cantón Montecristi, está casada pero su esposo  y dos de sus hijos vive en Estados Unidos desde hace quince años

 
Liliana se dedica a los quehaceres del  hogar y a la venta de prendas de vestir tanto a  amigos y familiares, ofrece mercadería para damas, caballeros y niños, prendas como blusas, ropa intima, pantalones licras y mas, trabaja a crédito para dar facilidad a sus clientes, los cobros los realiza cada quince días con ese dinero compra mercadería nuevamente para entregar los pedios pendientes de sus clientes.

En esta ocasión la señora Liliana esta solicitando un crédito a la fundación para comprar pantalones jeans, camisas, carteras, calzado para damas, caballeros y niños para mantener un stock surtido  para la época navideña
texts.en:
The Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi division of the beautiful and bountiful province of Manabí, located in Ecuador’s coastal region. This area is known for its handicrafts (the best straw hats in the world), traditional dishes, natural beauty, and friendly people. This Communal Bank consists of enterprising women who are looking to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Sra. Liliana P. is a member of the Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank and a resident of Montecristi. She is married, but her husband and two children have been living in the United States for 15 years.

Liliana engages in her household chores and her business selling clothing to friends and family. She offers clothing for men, women, and children. Her merchandise includes blouses, undergarments, spandex pants, and other items. Liliana works on credit to make it easy for her customers. She collects payments every two weeks and uses the money to buy goods to fulfill her outstanding customer orders.

On this occasion, Sra. Liliana is requesting a loan from the Foundation to buy jeans, shirts, handbags, and shoes for men, women, and children. She wants to maintain an assortment of products for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of clothing for the holiday season

loans.name: Celmira Monserrate

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa del Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por la elaboración de artesanías sobre todo se tejen los mejores sombreros de paja toquilla  del mundo, sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias.

En este bello lugar habita la señora Celmira A.,  es una joven mujer madre de dos hijos esta felizmente casada, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 4 años empezó con un pequeño bazar en su casa y lo ha ido incrementando con  productos de belleza de Yanbal como maquillaje, shampoo y mas, por el hecho de tener a sus hijos pequeñas no puede salir a vender de puerta en puerta.

Con  este nuevo préstamos solicitado a la Fundación ESPOIR  invertirá en productos para el hogar, regalos, perfumes, ropa, calzado, y  más productos para incrementar su bazar  y contar con un stock surtido para su exigente clientela en ésta navidad.

El sueño de Celmira es poder terminar sus estudios llegar hacer una profesional solo espera que sus hijos esten mas grandes para poder realizarlo.
texts.en:
The Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi division of the beautiful and bountiful province of Manabí, located in Ecuador’s coastal region. This area is known for its handicrafts (the best straw hats in the world), traditional dishes, natural beauty, and friendly people. This Communal Bank consists of enterprising women who are looking to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Sra. Celmira A. lives in this beautiful place. She is happily married and the mother of two children. For four years, Celmira has been trading out of a small bazaar she established out of her home. She has increased her inventory with Yanbal beauty products such as makeup, shampoo, and other items. Since she has small children, she is not able to go out and sell her products door-to-door.

With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she wants to invest in merchandise such as household products, gift items, perfumes, clothing, shoes, and other goods so that she can expand her bazaar and increase her inventory to satisfy her demanding customers this Christmas.

Celmira dreams of finishing her education so that she can become a professional. She hopes that her children will be able to do the same when they are older.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her bazaar

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es: La señora Leonila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun están bajo su poder.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes.
