Leonila, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Leonila, 40, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Her character and desire to see her dreams realized motivated her to start her own grocery sales business, the profits therefrom would be used to help defray household expenses. From the beginning until the present day, she has been gaining customers. Today, she can count on her regular customers who daily come by her store to buy because they find with her all the products that a housewife could want and they are waited on by herself personally with the charisma that is so characteristic of her. With this 1,000 sol loan she will by sacks of rice and sugar, crackers, pastas and packages of salt, boxes of milk and fish preserves of various brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene articles to continue to provide her customers with better service. Leonila feels good to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like herself to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase inventory.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: La señora Meri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella  y son su impulso, para seguir adelante.Meri, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. Meri, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Meri, 48, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque" communal bank in the Sacanche district, Huallaga province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, two of whom still depend on her and are her motivating force to continue forward. Meri is an efficient woman who, finding herself in need to generate her own income, decided to set up grocery sales in her home. She began bit by bit and now finds herself greatly improved with a good selection of products available to her customers and housewives who find what they need. Currently she continues with the same business and she tells us that she does quite well. With this 1,000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, boxes of milk and preserved fish of various brands, home cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items, packages of soft-drinks in various flavors and brands in order to offer better customer service. Meri feels herself to be a fulfilled woman with what she has managed to accomplish. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and to reach her dreams and goals and other women who want to grow as busineswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito D. Sacanche, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 63 años, y es madre D. 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Su fuerza  y anhelo D. sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico D. su familia. DesD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará sacos D. arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Maria, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Maria, 63, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are now independent. Her strength and desire to see her family get ahead motivated her to start her own business selling groceries from her home, a space that is well equipped to take care of her customers. Her daily profits help her to improve her family's income. From the beginning until today she has been gaining customers and now she has regular customers who daily come to her business to purchase because she has all the products that a housewife would need and she waits on them personally with the kindness and charisma which so characterize her. With this 2,000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, pasta, packages of salt and oil, boxed milk and preserved fish of various brands, flats of eggs, and personal hygiene items to proviD. better customer service. Maria feels very good to continue working and prepares herself daily to face whatever challenges life might present. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Luz Amanda

texts.es: La señora Luz Amanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que  son estudiantes y aun depende de ella.Luz Amanda, mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, CyZone, Avon y Unique, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Se siente muy contenta y tranquila con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de catálogos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.   Luz Amanda, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Amanda, 37, is a member of the "Los Diamantes" communal bank in the Eslabon district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She has a life partner and is the mother of two children, both of whom are students and still dependent upon her. Luz Amanda is a hard-working woman who, with her characteristic fighter spirit and desire to get ahead by her own efforts, was motivated to start her own business selling cosmetics of the Esika, CyZone, Avon and Unique brands without a boss or a set schedule. Little by little she became well known among her customers and today she tells us that she does quite well with this activity. Currently, she continues with the same line of work, located in her own home, where she sells all day. Sometimes, she goes out to sell door-to-door. She feels happy and calm with what she does. With this 500 sol loan she will buy catalogue products like: perfumes and refreshing colognes, body and face creams, lipsticks and compact powders to keep her customers happy and satisfied. Luz Amanda is calm and happy with what she does and grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio Vázquez es casado con la señora Claudia Marcela Nájera y son padres de unos niños de edad escolar, el labora para una empresa marmolera como pulidor desde hace 8 años. Y obtienen otros ingresos ya que junto con su familia iniciaron  su propio negocio de nombre “Abarrotes Vázquez “establecido desde hace 1 año, y sus ingresos se han incrementando ya que su clienta los prefieren por la buena atención que les brindan, ellos están tramitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía de su negocio ya que invertirán en mayoreo para así obtener mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. is married to Mrs. Claudia Marcela Nájera. They are the parents of children are at school age. He works for a company as a polisher at a marble factory where he has been for the last 8 years. He started with his family a pantry shop business which became his second income. It is called "Abarrotes V.” and was established a year ago. Its revenues are increasing as their client prefers them because of the good customer service they provide.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of grocery products at a whole sale to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es: La señora Balentina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre de 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Cerdos, que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará cerdos bebes. Parte de dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas.Balentina, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Balentina, 64, is a member of the "Los Diamantes" communal bank located in the Eslabon district, Huallaga province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent. Her enterprising spirit and love of family motivated her to start her own pig sales business. Little by little she gained more experience and growth in this type of activity becoming very well-known and liked by her customers. Currently, she continues with the same line of work and it is she, herself, who tends to it with joy and enthusiasm. With this 3,000 sol loan she will buy baby pigs. Part of the money will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins. Balentina fells tranquil and happy with what she does and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Jesus Hector

texts.es: El señor Jesús Héctor C. P. es casado con la señora Juanita López Olivares y son una pareja madura muy unida, ya todos sus hijos están casados. El señor Jesús Héctor trabaja para una empresa de comida congelada en el área de encargado desde hace 8 años. Ellos como una familia unida esta tramitando este crédito ya que desean ampliar su vivienda para una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Héctor C. P. is married to Mrs. Juanita López Olivares. They are a very close couple, since all their children are already married.

Mr. C. works for a Frozen food company in the packing area, and has been there for the last 8 years. They are asking for a loan that will be used to remodel their home to make it more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build walls at a home

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es: La señora Armandina C. esta separada de su pareja y es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, y para salir adelante y sostener un hogar ella estableció su propio negocio de nombre “Estética C. “desde hace 2 años, en la cual ya tiene su propia clientela por el buen trabajo que realiza y el buen trato a sus clientes, ella esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de algunos productos para tener al momento que su clientela lo solicita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Armandina C. is divorced and the mother of a child who goes to school. In order to provide for her family, she established her own business called "Estetica C." 2 years ago. Currently she has her own clientele because of a job well done and the good customer service she provides.

She is asking for a loan that will be used in the purchase of some beauty products that her clients request.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: El Tocte (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tocte  se formó en la hermosa ciudad de Cuenca, cuna de artistas, escritores, deportistas,  dueña de una riqueza incalculable de arquitectura e historia acoge al turista nacional y extranjero para brindarle toda la belleza natural que encierra la urbe y su entorno.

Este banco lo integran hombres y mujeres emprendedores con deseos de superarse cada día tanto en sus hogares  como en  su comunidad para ofrecer a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida basada en valores como la honestidad, el trabajo, la ayuda mutua para alcanzar los objetivos planteados.

La señora  Norma  Lucía C. es socia del banco comunal el Tocte, vive en el cantón de Gualaceo a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 21 años convive con su esposo y su niña de un año cuatro mese, su cónyuge trabaja como estuquero, cuidan una casa y en ella habitan ya que aún no tienen casa propia.

Norma comparte sus actividades entre  los quehaceres domésticos y la cría de animales como cuyes y  gallinas  para venderlos a sus vecinos de la comunidad y para el consumo en casa.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal, nos comenta que los préstamos le han ayudado para comprar sus animales  y su  alimento,  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a comprar  más cuyes y gallinas, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza para incrementar su criadero.

El señor  Luis Z. es el único hombre en su  banco comunal, él  vive en la parroquia de Jadan en el sector el Tocte, tiene 29 años de edad, se encuentra soltero y vive con sus padres apoyándolos un poco económicamente ya que  tiene un hijo de 6 años por lo que tiene que  solventar los gastos de mantención y  estudio de su niño.

 Luis trabaja como estuquero  tiene su taller propio lleva 12 años trabajando en este oficio, su horario es de lunes a viernes, también  tiene un pequeño bazar donde expende principalmente  hilos, agujas, lanas y más artículos para las manualidades.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal  y nos comenta que los préstamos le han ayudado mucho para comprar los materiales necesarios para su trabajo, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a  comprar materiales como carrizo,  cal,  para seguir elaborando las planchas de cielo raso  para mantener abastecido  su negocio y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su gran sueño es llegar hacer un gran comerciante.
texts.en:
The Tocte Community Bank is based in the beautiful city of Cuenca, which is home to artists, writers and sportsmen. The city has a priceless wealth of architecture and history and welcomes domestic and foreign tourists to see all the natural beauty that the city and its surroundings offer. This bank is composed of both men and women entrepreneurs with a daily desire to overcome both at home and in their community to give their families a better quality of life based on values such as honesty, hard work and mutual support to achieve their objectives. Mrs. Norma Lucia Court is a member of the Tocte Community Bank and lives in the town of Gualaceo on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is 21 and lives with her husband and child of 1 year and 4 months of age. Her husband works as roof designer, and they jointly care for the house and live there but still do not own their own home. Norma splits her time between household chores and raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens to sell to her neighbors in the community and for consumption at home. She has been with her community bank for three cycles and says that the loans have helped to buy animals and food. With this new loan provided by Fundación Espoir, she will buy more guinea pigs, chickens, feed and vitamins for breeding in order to increase the size of her farm. Mr. Luis Z. is the only man in his village bank. He lives in the parish of Jadan in the Tocte sector. He is 29 years old, is unmarried and lives with his parents who he supports financially a bit. He has a 6-year old for whom he covers the costs of living and study. Luis works as a roof designer and has his own workshop. He has been working for 12 years in this job. His hours are Monday through Friday. He also has a small stand at the local market where he mainly sells thread, needles, wool and more items for crafts. This is his third cycle working with his community bank. He stated that the loans have greatly helped him to buy materials needed for his work. With the new loan provided by Fundación Espoir, he is going to buy materials such as reeds to further develop roofs in order to keep his inventory stocked and to provide good service to his customers. His big dream is to become a great trader.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed and vitamins, buy roofing materials

loans.name: Sonia Hermelinda

texts.es: La señora Sonia Hermelinda R. es soltera y solamente vive con un hijo pequeño, ya que sus demás hijos ya están casados y viven fuera de la ciudad, ella tiene un negocio establecido desde hace 2 años de venta de tacos, gorditas etc;en la salida de nuestra ciudad.Ella esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración y venta de comida en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda Sonia R. is single and lives with one of her sons since the other ones are married and living outside the city. She started a business 2 years ago, selling meals as tacos, gorditas, etc., in the entrance to the city.

She is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare meals for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Martin Librado

texts.es: El señor Martín Librado es casado con la señora Velia Ramírez Guerrero ellos viven con sus hijos que aun no están casados, pero que los apoyan en los gastos familiares. Su esposa trabaja para una empresa donde elaboran vestidos, uniformes, etc. Desde hace 8 años como supervisora, por otra parte sus hijos laboran para empresas establecidas, y el señor Martín Librado es propietario de un negocio de elaboración y venta de puerta y ventanas de aluminio establecido desde hace 3 años, todos ellos como una familia unida y emprendedora están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de un piso de concreto en el área de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Martin Librado is married to Mrs. Velia Ramírez Guerrero. They live with their children who are single, and contribute with the family expenses. His wife works for a company which makes clothing, uniforms, etc and has been there for the last 8 years as a supervisor. Their children are working for established companies, and Mr. Martin Librado owns a business making and selling aluminum doors and windows. He started the business 3 years ago.

They are a very close and entrepreneur family. He is asking for a loan that will be used for laying a concrete floor in the building where the business is located.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: laying a concrete floor in the building where the business is located.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor Calderón y su esposa la señora Alondra son una familia joven pero muy trabajadora y unida, el labora para una empresa en el área de operador, están tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su vivienda ya que vienen las temporadas de lluvia, y no quieren que sus muebles y paredes se dañen por tanta humedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor Calderón and his wife Mrs. Alondra are a young and hardworking family. He works for a company as an operator. They are asking for a loan that will be used in waterproofing the roof of their house since the rainy season is approaching and do not want their furniture and walls to get damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix the roof of the house

loans.name: Blanca Zorayda

texts.es: La señora Blanca Zorayda es casada con el señor José González y son un matrimonio muy emprendedor, ellos tienen su propio negocio de nombre “Abarrotes N. “ establecido desde hace 5 años, y están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Zorayda is married to Mr. Jose Gonzalez. They are entrepreneurs and have their own business called "Abarrotes Nino" which they started 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan that willbe invested in the purchase of merchandise to restock the business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente F. vive con su esposa y familia, su esposa la señora Norma Alicia Medrano labora para un editorial desde hace 1 año como gerente de recursos humanos, el señor Vicente tiene su propio negocio de venta de muebles seminuevos establecido desde hace 11 años. Y están tramitando este crédito para la inversión al negocio en compra de más mercancía como pedidos de muebles que sus clientes le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente F. lives with his wife and family. His wife Mrs. Norma Alicia Medrano has worked for an editorial company as a human resources manager for the last year.

Mr. Vincente runs his own business selling pre-owned furniture and has been in this business for 11 years. He is asking for a loan that will be invested to buy more merchandise that his customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior con el cual su negocio ha crecido y ha tenido más ingreso con los cuales ha podido construir unos cuartos en la parte trasera de su casa.
Les está haciendo falta el techo, pero desea ponerlo de concreto ya que es más duradero y segura, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que esta obteniendo su negocio, ya que gracias a ustedes a tenido mas clientes y esta en mejores condiciones su local.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Manuel P. is very grateful for the help with the previous loan. since then his business has grown and his income has increased, so has been able to build some bedrooms in the back of his house.

The rooms still need to be roofed and he wants to use concrete as it is more durable and secure. He does not have enough money to buy the materials and pay the labor for this improvement.

He is asking for a loan and plans to repay it with some of the profits from his business. Thanks to the previous loan he has gained more clients and the business is in a better position.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio M. está muy agradecido por si cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo terminar el cuarto de sus hijos y empezar otra construcción.
 En la cual le está haciendo falta el techo y el también desea que sea de losa ya que es mas duradera y segura para la familia.
Don Flavio es empleado en una compañía de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de camión de carga. Este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte sera para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Flavio is very appreciative for his previous loan, with which he was able to finish the construction on his children's room and begin another. His new construction project lacks a roof, which he hopes can be made with a stone slab, which is more durable and safe for his family. Flavio works for a transportation company as a driver of a cargo truck. This is how he generates income for his family as well as repayments on his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: installation of a stone roof in his home

loans.name: Sonia Elena

texts.es: La señora Sonia Elena es madre soltera y vive con su hijo Joel Alberto, el labora para un restaurante desde hace 2 años como mesero, la señora Sonia también labora en el mismo restaurante como ayudante de cocina desde hace 3 años. Ellos son una familia que se apoya mutuamente para salir adelante, por lo tanto establecieron un negocio propio desde hace 1 año, el cual es una tiendita de abarrotes. Están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de un cuarto en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia Elena is a single mother who lives with her son Joel Alberto. For the past two years he has worked as a waiter at the same restaurant where she has worked as a kitchen assistant for the past three years. They are a mutually supportive family who hope to get ahead and thus, established their own small grocery store one year ago. They are requesting a loan for the construction of a room at the rear of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a room

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Ma. De los Ángeles A. E. vive solo con su hijo que es una persona con capacidades diferentes, ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa semi-nuva establecida desde hace 15 años. Y esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de más mercancía pero de juguetes ya que se acercan las fiestas de navidad y para tener en venta.
texts.en:
Ma. de los Angeles lives with her son and is a woman with many different abilities. For the past 15 years she has run her own business selling gently worn clothing. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of additional merchandise, particularly toys for Christmas since the holiday season is coming up.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, especially toys, to sell

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: El señor Jorge Armando O. U. es casado con la señora Gladys Alejandra y son padres de familia de 3 niños en edad escolar, el labora para una empresa reconocida de nuestra ciudad en el área de operador, su esposa trabaja cuidando a unos niños en el transcurso de la semana. Ellos están tramitando este crédito para la compra de una sala nueva en su hogar, ya que desean darle un giro de modernidad a casa.
texts.en:
Jorge Armando is the husband of Gladys Alejandra and father of three school-age children. He works for a well-known company as an operator. His wife takes care of the children during the week. They are requesting this credit to purchase new living room furniture for their home, which they would like to modernize.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ma. Isabel D. es casada y con hijos en edad escolar, ella y su marido tienen su negocio propio establecido desde hace 2 años, de nombre “Abarrotes Aiko” y tiene ya su propia clientela ya que los buscan por la calidad de sus productos, porque encuentran siempre lo que buscan y la atención al cliente, y para seguir surtiendo algunos productos solicitados por sus clientes están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is married with school-age children. Her and her husband have their own business, which they established two years ago and called "Abarrotes Aiko." They have their own customers who go to their grocery store for the quality of their products and because they always find what they are looking for. She is requesting this loan so that she can continue to keep the store stocked with the products that her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a shop for storage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicides

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria R. is from the village of Punta Dulapo. She is 58 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Candelaria owns and operates a business planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Candelaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Mrs. Alma E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 36 years old, is married, and is blessed with two school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a poultry business. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years earning 3,000 PHP monthly income. In 2009, Alma joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her first loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her poultry

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena T. is a 67-year-old married woman who has five children. They are currently living at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Magdalena successfully repaid her first loan of 7,000 PHP and she is now requesting a second loan of 7,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari store. She will be purchasing additional items to make her little store full of stock. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC.

Magdalena plans to expand her little store into a convenience store and wishes to see her family succeed in its chosen field of business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa A. is a member of the KIVA field partner in the Philippines, ASHI. She belongs to the Bitadton center of Antique North Branch in Culasi, a beautiful municipality of the Antique province surrounded by the crystal clear water of the sea. Aside from the blessing of nature surrounding her dwelling place, she is also gifted with a supportive husband and five loving children whose age ranges from seven to 13 years old.  

To be able to nourish her blessings such as her family, Leonisa makes use of her productive skill. She put up a business using loans she had requested through ASHI. The first time she received a loan, she had her hog (pig) fattening and furniture-making business managed by her husband. Being poor, Leonisa had no other option to support the needs of her family but to sell her hogs after four months. Although her furniture making business continued, Leonisa could not efficiently cope with the demands of their customers due to insufficient business capital. Now she is requesting a much larger loan to meet the growing demands of their customers as well as her children and their education.

loans.use: To finance her furniture-making business and to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn A. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Jackielyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jackielyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jackielyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jackielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jackielyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jackielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie V. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 26 years old. Jessie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jessie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Shah Jan Group

texts.en:
Shah Jan is the group leader of Mary Jan Sediqa group. There are three members in this group. Shah Jan is a married woman with five children, three sons and two daughters. All her daughters are married and the sons are at school. Shah Jan wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business. 

Mary Jan wants to take a loan for her husband’s metal shop business. He wants to expand his business. 

Reza Gull wants to take a loan for her business which is the designing of chadari,  a kind of head cover for women in Afghanistan. She wants to increase the number of clients for her business. 
The women have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. They say that this loan will be very useful because they will provide a chance for poor people in this country.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Karta Ariana Group

texts.en:
Zalega is the group leader of the Karta Ariana 5 group. There are four members in this group.  They live in district 15 in Kabul Afghanistan. Zalega is the group leader.  She is 45 years old and she has four children, three daughters and one son. All her children are in school. Zalega wants to take a loan for the bakery she operates from her house. She needs wood for her bakery.

Mahfoz and Mohammad Sader want to take a loan for their fresh fruit selling business. They want to expand their business. 

Shakyllah wants to take a loan for the tailoring business she runs from her house. She wants to buy three new sewing machines. 

They have requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani.  They would like to say thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Mrs. Shirley M. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, a widow, and is blessed with five adult children. Shirley has a monthly pension of 3,000 PHP and an allotment from her sons from abroad of 5,000 PHP monthly. In 2004, Shirley joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 10th loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchased housing materials. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa M. lives in the village of Brgy Vito, Sagay, Negros Occidental. She is 46 years old, and married to Renato M. who is a fisherman and the father of her two children. The children are 10 and 12 years old, and both are attending school. Teresa dreams of uplifting their living and being  able to send their two children to school and get a college degree so that they will have better opportunities for a more comfortable life.

From the time she got married, Teresa was the one who sold his catch to members of their community and sometimes even in the public market. Sometimes they get lucky and the customers are the ones who approach them to buy her husband's catch of the day. Teresa and her husband own their fishing boat, but in 1997, they needed money to do some major repair to their boat. This motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could access the necessary capital to fund their fishing operations. As she paid off each loan, she was able to borrow more funds to further improve their fishing business, buying new nets and other fishing gear. Now she is able to earn a net profit of PHP 10,000 per month from their fishing operations. She saves most of her profits for the education of her family, taking out only the most necessary funds to support their household expenses.

In her previous loan, she borrowed Php 19,500 that she used as additional capital or revolving working fund for her fishing business. The loan was fully paid within her loan term without any delays in any of the weekly installments. Now for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing the same amount of Php 19,500 to be used for the repair of her fishing boat. She intends to use the income from it for the education of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is a 45-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children between 21 and 25 years old. The family lives in the village of Brgy Miranda Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Georgina dreams of giving a proper education to her three children so that someday they will be gainfully employed, and not have to go through the difficulties she experienced in her life, needing to work hard just to survive. 

These aspirations make Georgina a strong mother to her children and mobilize her to earn for the future and family by helping her husband earn a living for their family. She started with a small general store adjacent to her house, which helped a lot in supplementing their family income, but as her children grew older, their needs also grew, especially in relation to their education. She also wanted to expand her business and offer her customers a wider range of products. This motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon and that was how she started to expand her business. Now she has an electronic reloading station - selling prepaid load to mobile phone users.  Now she earns an average of PHP 10,000 per month.

In her previous loan, she borrowed Php 23,000, which she used as additional capital for her general store and electronic reloading. The said amount was paid within her loan term in full without delays. Now she is borrowing Php 24,000 as additional capital for her general store and to invest in a food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional capital for her general store and to start a food vending business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro nacio en Chuqisaca, pero desde hace mas 20 años radica en la comunidad de la planchada, en el municipio de El Torno , que desta aproximadamente 130 Kms. de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Toda su familia se dedica a la agricultura, esposa y sus cinco hijos; siembran maiz, mani, papa, arroz y tambien cuentan con algunas cabezas de ganado. Credito requiere para comprar una motosierra, herramienta  muy util en el campo.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in Chuqisaca, but for the last 20 years he has lived in the La Planchada community in the El Torno municipal, which is approximately 130 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. His whole family, which includes his wife and five children, work in agriculture. They plant corn, peanuts, and rice. They also raise some livestock. He requests the loan to buy a power saw, a very useful tool for the field.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a powersaw

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: The path that a family takes, whether for good or not, always depends on decisions that the husband and wife jointly make. This has been the experience of Elvira A. of Canonoy, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Elvira is 49 years old and is married with four children who are between 18 and 25 years old. Elvira's husband earns a living by fishing. Years ago, they owned a small unmotorized fishing boat that he had to paddle to go to sea. This was truly hard work, especially during stormy weather when the waves are a lot rougher than usual. But, because he had no other way to earn money to feed and support his family, he determinedly rowed his boat to sea everyday to catch fish, so that Elvira would have something to sell to people in their community and neighboring villages. In 2000, Elvira, with the consent of her husband, decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that they could borrow money to improve their income. With the new capital, Elvira opened a small general store so that she could earn a little more. As she made good on her loan repayments and established a good credit record, she was able to borrow larger amounts to improve her income potential. One of their first investments from her loans was a joint decision to buy a motor for their fishing boat so that her husband could reach deeper waters and catch more fish - which he did. The motorized fishing boat and the income from the general store made a big impact on improving their family's quality of life. They currently earn a net monthly income of PHP 8,000 from their two business activities. The fishing business is doing quite well, so that Elvira and her husband are now saving up to buy another motorized fishing boat to increase their income even further. As previously mentioned here, Elvira has kept a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. In her previous loan she borrowed Php 10,000 as additional capital for their businesses and, as is her usual practice, she was able to pay it off within the loan term and without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is borrowing Php 15,000 so that they can finally purchase their second motorized boat. The income from it will be used to buy more productive assets so that they can continue improving their family's quality of life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Sr. De Malta Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Señor D. Malta  es grupo antiguo que se encuentra en su 4º ciclo es responsable en sus pago y que no entraron en Mora ya que son socias comprometidas con nuestra Institucion. Este Banco esta dirigido por la Sra. Betty  quien es la lider y muy responsable en sus pagos ella  tiene 5 hijos y tiene su negocio D. venta D. hamburguesas en la esquina D. su casa, como Tesorera se encuentra la Sra. Nancy, quien es una persona joven es casada tiene 2 hijas y tiene el negocio D. venta D. muñecas D. peluches en la Av. San Martin a persar D. estar en su segundo ciclo demostrò ser muy responsable y puntual en sus cuotas  y como Secretaria se encuentra la socia Marlen  tiene 1 hijo tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida . El crèdito es para aumentar el Capital D. sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Bank D. Emprendimiento Senor D. Malta is an older group in its 4th loan cycle. The group is responsible with its payments and has not been delinquent because they are reliable members of our institution. This bank is led by Mrs. Betty who is very punctual with her payments. She has 5 children and has a business of selling hamburgers at the corner of her house. The treasurer is Mrs. Nancy, a young lady, married with 2 daughters. Her business is selling stuffed animals on San Martin Avenue. Although this is her second loan cycle, she has shown to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. Mrs. Marlen is the secretary. She has 1 son and her business is selling food. The loan is to raise capital for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise capital

loans.name: Amanecer 2 Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy antiguo y muy responsables en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "AMANECER 2", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 6º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias responsable y activas,  como presidenta esta  la señora Corali, ella es lider de su grupo, elabora variedad de masitas (reposteria) en su domicilio, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja con taxi trufi (ruta fija). Como tesorera esta la socia Luisa, quien es muy responsable, es casada tiene 3 hijos ella vende zapatos y su esposo trabaja con auto en un Radio movil,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Gregoria,  quien es una socia fundadora del grupo, tiene 1 hijo pequeño trabaja limpiando oficinas y lavando ropa, esposo es pintor.
texts.en:
This well-established group is very responsible with its payments, and they live in the same neighborhood where they know each other well. The group is called the "Amanecer 2" Community Bank, and it is in it's sixth round of loans. The Board of Directors is made up of responsible and active partners. Sra. Corali is the leader of her group, and she makes a variety of pastries from her home. She has three children, and her husband drives a fixed-route cab. Luisa is the treasurer and is very responsible. She is married with three children. She sells shoes and her husband works as a driver for a Mobile Radio. She will use the loan to increase her stock. Gregoria is the secretary, and is a founding member of the group. She has one small son and works cleaning offices and washing clothes. Her husband is a painter.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: 53-year-old Lucia A. lives in Canonoy, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Her husband originally earned a living from making wine from coconut sap (tuba) which they sold to people around the neighborhood. The couple is blessed with four adult children who are now between 28 and 34 years old, some of whom are gainfully employed and are therefore helping in the support of their family. Lucia hopes that she can continue improving their family's lifestyle through their family's collective hard work. As a wife, Lucia always had a realistic view of their family's situation. She very well knew that the income her husband earned as a tuba maker was just not enough to cover all of their expenses and the increasing need for finances. Because they lived near the sea, Lucia decided that, if she had some capital, she'd engage in the buying and selling of fish to her neighbors and to people in the surrounding villages. To get the necessary access to new capital, Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and this enabled them to rent a fishing boat that one of her sons used for fishing, while she continued with her fish-vending venture. With the additional income they were able to buy their own motorized fishing boat soon after. This has enabled them to earn an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Her Credit Record: Lucia’s previous loan of Php 12,000 was utilized as additional capital for her fish-vending business. The loan was fully repaid on time and within the designated loan term without any delays. Now, her 13th loan of Php 14,000 will be used to buy an engine for her fishing boat and to make a few repairs and maintenance work on it. The income from it will be used for the improvement of the family’s living conditions. In the accompanying photo, Lucia is shown with the motorized fishing boat that her son just finished painting. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a boat engine and to repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es: La Señora Dina, es una cliente nueva que viene por recomendación de su sobrina que tambien comenzo a trabajr con la institucion hace unas semanas atrás, la señora tiene una tienda en su domicilio pero tambien tiene su almacen en el centro de la ciudad, las ventas que tiene en este almacen son buenas, sobre todo con el convenio que tiene con el Ministerio de Gobierno para proveer de alimentos al Centro Penitenciario Femenino de Obrajes. La señora Dina es madre soltera y se dedica a este rubro hace ya seis años, con la ayuda de su familia en especial el de sus hermanas que la ayudan a con el niño y el trabajo es que el negocio a ido creciendo en ventas, ahora la misma institucion con la que trabaja le dio el visto bueno para que arme los canastones de fin de año de los empleados para lo que necesitaba el dinero con urgencia porque los productos que incluia en su canaston estaban siendo ofrecidos por sus clientes a precios bajos
texts.en:
Sra. Dina is a new client who came on the suggestion of her niece who began working with the organization several weeks previously. She runs a shop from her home as well as a store in the city center. Sales from this store are good, above all due to the agreement she has with the government ministry to supply food to the Obrajes Women's Prison. Sra. Dina is a single mother and has already dedicated herself to this work for six years with the help of her family and especially that of her two sisters who help her with the baby and the business, since sales have been growing.

She requires the loan urgently because the institution she has been working with gave her approval to make up New Year's baskets for its employees, and the products she includes in her baskets are being offered to customers at low prices.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for New Year's baskets

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mary Luz, vino a la institución por recomendación de un cliente antiguo,  es una persona muy joven, es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño de un año, el padre de su hijo le dejó el transporte (taxi), ella lo hace trabajar con un chofer quien le da renta diaria, tiene familiares que viven en los Yungas a aproximadamente 200 Kms de la ciudad de La Paz; no tiene deudas en otras instituciones, tiene referencias buenas de los vecinos como una persona muy trabajadora, por tal razon se le binda este trato preferencial y esperamos que trabaje de manera responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary Luz came to the Institution upon the recommendation of a long-time client. This young woman is a single mother with a one year old child. The father of her child left her taxi, which she rents out to a driver on a daily basis. She has relatives who live in Los Yungas, which is approximately 200 km from the city of La Paz.

Mary Luz has no outstanding debts with other institutions. She presents good references from neighbors who consider her to be a hardworking woman. For this reason, she has been given preferential treatment with the expectation that she will work responsibly with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert her taxi into a natural gas powered vehicle

loans.name: Elvis Alencar

texts.es: Don Elvis, actualmente vive el la localidad de la Guardia, aproximadamente 100 Kms. de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, su actividad economica principal es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia movilidad trabaja, realizando el servicio en la ciudad de Santa Cruz; El cliente es soltero con todas las ganas de superación su deseo es comprar su propia vivienda, el cliente esta agradecido por el apoyo que le brinda la institución y su crédito solicitado lo destinara para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Don Elvis currently lives in the town of La Guardia, which is approximately 100 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He utilizes his own vehicle for providing passenger transport services. He conducts most of his business in Santa Cruz.

Don Elvis is single. With everything that he has achieved, his greatest desire is to own a home. He is grateful for the support of the Institution. The loan will be used to pay for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es un hombre que siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro, tiene 51 años, está casado y es padre de 9 hijos, de los cuales 5 de ellos viven en su casa.

Él se dedica a la siembra de papas y olluco en sus chacras temporales (se riegan con la lluvia), pero desde hace 15 años también vende carne, y con estas dos actividades mantiene tranquilamente a sus numerosos hijos. La labor que más le agrada es la compra y venta de ganado, por serle muy rentable; por ello, el fin de semana madruga para comprar los animales que se encuentran a un menor precio y le dejan mayores ganancias al venderlos por kilos. 
Pero, los demás días de la semana están centrados en velar por sus cultivos, ya que cuando suben los precios de la papa también gana muy bien, pues anteriormente con una de esas cosechas pudo construir su casa propia hace poco. Ahora su deseo es incrementar sus cultivos de papas para tener el dinero suficiente para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, Teófilo siempre pagó todas sus cuotas puntualmente, además menciona estar muy contento con sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra carneros y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teófilo always has a smile on his face. He is 51 years old, married, and the father of 9 children of whom 5 still live at home.

He grows potatoes and ulluco in fields that he irrigates with rainwater. For 15 years, he has also been selling meat. These two business activities have enabled him to support all of his children. The work he enjoys the most is buying and selling livestock because it is very profitable. On the weekends, he leaves early so that he can find animals for the lowest price and make more profit when he sells the meat by the kilo.

On the other days of the week, Teófilo focuses on maintaining his crops. When the price of potatoes goes up, he makes very good money. In fact, the earnings from one of his recent crops enabled him to build his home. Now he hopes to increase his potato harvest so that he can have enough money to pay for his children’s education.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Teófilo always makes his payments on time and says that he is happy with the other members of his Communal Bank. The money he requested will be used to buy mutton (sheep) and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Roque

texts.es:
Don Jose  Vive el la localidad de la Guardia, poblacion que se encuentra a las afueras de Santa Cruz,  su actividad economica principal es el servicio de alojamiento, rentan piezas a personas que estan de pasada por el pueblo; su esposa la señora Magnolia le colabora en el negocio, tienen un hijo pequeño.
Los cliente están agradecido con la institución por  el apoyo brindado, el crédito lo destinaran para aumento de su capital de trabajo, compra de frazadas, sabanas y catres.
texts.en:
Don Jose lives in the community of La Guardia, which is located on the outskirts of Santa Cruz. He provides lodging services, renting out rooms to people who pass through the village. He manages the business with his wife, Sra. Magnolia. They have one small child.

Don Jose is grateful for the support provided by the Institution. His loan will be used as operating capital to purchase blankets, sheets, and cots.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, sheets, and cots

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es un hombre de 47 años, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos, con los que vive, junto a su esposa en su casa propia.

Por muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra: papa, olluco, oca y cebada en chacras de  tierras comunales de su pueblo, con la ayuda de su esposa. Pero adicionalmente, hace unos años, viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de papas en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad, los días miércoles de preferencia, ya que ese día bajan todos los agricultores a la ciudad con sus productos, por ello es muy concurrida. 
Desde que se dedica a este negocio siente que su economía es mucho más dinámica, ahora Teófilo no solo espera sus cosechas, sino que también compra de sus vecinos para revenderlas a otros precios en el mercado.
Teófilo se siente un padre feliz por lo que hace,  y a la vez está contento porque sus hijos no pasan carencias económicas.  Si sigue trabajando de este modo piensa alquilar un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad para cuando sus hijos crezcan y mejore su calidad de vida.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo viene trabajando con mucha responsabilidad y más aun como secretario de su banco  comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra y venta de papas, así como para adquirir fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 47 years old and lives in his own home. He is married and the father of 4 children.

For many years he has been engaged in agriculture, growing crops such as potatoes, ulluco, oca, and barley in the community fields of his town. His wife helps him with this work. In addition, he has spent a number of years buying and selling potatoes at the city wholesale market. Teófilo prefers to go to market on Wednesdays since that is the day when all the local farmers arrive with their produce, thereby generating a lot of activity.

Since becoming a potato trader, Teófilo feels his financial situation has received a tremendous boost. Not only can he rely on his crops, he can also buy his neighbors’ harvests to resell at a higher price in the market. As a father, Teófilo is very pleased with what he has achieved. He is glad that his children do not have to experience financial difficulties. If he continues working in this manner, he will be able to rent a vending post at the city market so that his children can grow and improve their quality of life.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. During his time with the Communal Bank, Teófilo has demonstrated great responsibility through his work as the group secretary. The money he requested will be used to buy potatoes to sell, as well as chemical fertilizers for his own crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional potatoes to sell & fertilizers for his own crops

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don Mario vive en la comunidad de Villa Tumavi a 15 Km. de la localidad de El Torno su actividad principal el transporte debiendo recorrero diariamente mas de 120 KM (distancia a la ciudad de Santa Cruz); es divorciado y tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos, los cuales están en edad colegial, recibe colaboración de sus padres.
texts.en:
Don Mario lives in the community of Villa Tumavi, which is 15 km from the town of El Torno. His main business activity is providing transportation services. On a daily basis, Don Mario travels more than 120 km (the distance required to reach the city of Santa Cruz). He is divorced and has two children who are of college age. They receive assistance from both of their parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento AMIGAS INSEPARABLES se encuentra en su 2do ciclo. Sra. Loida; Ella es presidenta del grupo,  se dedica a la venta de carteras de cuero, su mercaderia la compra en la ciudad de Santa Cruz y cuando tiene muchos pedidos, viaja hasta la ciudad de Oruro.El crédito solicitado es para invertir en su negocio comprara una variedad de carteras para las fietsas de fin de año, su deseo de la señora es ampliar su negocio.Ella manifiesta estar agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
Sra. Marisol es la tesorera del grupo; es separada de su esposo, tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive; se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva trabaja como ambulante, no tiene puesto fijo el crédito solicitado lo invirtió comprando mercadería. Manifiesta estar agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
Sr. Juan, es el secretario del grupo el se dedica al servicio del trasporte, tiene un taxi, con el cual mantiene a su familia, esposa y tres hijos, aun en edad escolar.La cliente esta agradecida por al apoyo brindado por la institución.
texts.en:
The AMIGAS INSEPARABLES enterprising bank is in its second cycle. Loida is the group leader and sells leather wallets. She buys her materials in the city of Santa Cruz and, when she has a lot of orders, travels to the city of Oruro. The requested financing is to buy a variety of wallets for end-of-year festivities; she wishes to expand her business. She is grateful to the institution for the help rendered. Marisol is the group treasurer. She is separated from her husband and has two children that live with her. She is a traveling salesperson of new clothing; she does not have a fixed place of business. The requested funds were used to buy merchandise. She states that she is grateful for the credit extended to her. Juan is the group secretary and supports his family, made up of his wife and three school-age children, with his earnings as a taxi driver. He is grateful for the help he has gotten from the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Guembe Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento GUEMBE esta en su  1er. ciclo, todas las socias se conocen desD. hace años. Sra. Revodia es la presidenta del grupo ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, actividad que la realiza en su propio domicilio;  su esposo es chofer asalariado, pero tambien le colabora a la esposa atendiendoesta la pension.El crédito solicitado es para invertir en su negocio D. la venta D. comida su deseo D. la señora es ampliar su restaurante.
Sra. Elizabeth, es la tesorera del banco D. emprendimiento, es madre soltera con dos bellos niños, que aun estan en edad escolar; se dedica a la venta D. joyas y ropa trabaja como ambulante, el crédito solicitado lo invirtió comprando mercadería que por las fiestas D. fin D. año sus pedidos se incrementaran. 
Sra.- Glady, es la secretaria del banco D. emprendimiento, es casada con cuatro hijos, el esposo es albañil contratista, que se desplaza D. pueblo en pueblo; ella se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos la señora desea crecer en su negocio y comprar un puesto.La cliente esta agradecida por al apoyo brindado por la institución.
texts.en:
The GUEMBE enterprising bank is in its first cycle. All the members have known each other for many years. Revodia is the group's president and sells prepared food from her home; her husband is a salaried driver but also helps his wife tend to her guests. The financing is to invest in her meal selling business; her wish is to enlarge her restaurant. Elizabeth is the bank's treasurer. She is a single mother of two beautiful, school-age, children. She is a traveling salesperson of jewelry and clothing. The funds requested were invested in the purchase of merchandise since her orders over the holiday season will increase. Glady, the group secretary, is married and has four children. Her husband is a bricklayer contractor who goes from town to town. She sells cosmetics and wants to increase her business and buy a sales stall. She is grateful for the help the institution has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Empredimiento APOSTOL SANTIAGO viene trabajando en nuestra Institución hace ocho ciclos, desD. el año 1997, este banco tiene como caracteristica que la mayoria D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos D. belleza,viveres y ropa, este banco a logrado cohesionarse y convertirse en un grupo  emprendedor. JULIA, es una participante antigua y ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, se dedica a la venta D. viveres en las paradas D. Minibuses en la zona D. Chijini, con el prestamo a podido comprar por cantidad productos como: aceite,azúcar,harina, fideo y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus pedidos.La Sra, Julia tiene una familia númeR. y con los pedidos a logrado mejorar sus ingresos. JAQUELINE es una D. la socias fundadoras, actualmente ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, tiene una familia conformada por 3 miembros, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa en la ciudad D. La Paz y realiza viajes hasta Yacuiba (frontera con la republica Argentina) D. donD. tambien trae productos como vajillas y productos D. belleza, con el prestamo otorgado por la institución, ella a logrado aumentar su capital y sus ingresos logrando D. esta forma mejorar la calidad D. vida D. ella y su familia. ROSMERY,  es una participante antigua y tiene la función D. Tesorera, es artesana y trabaja en la elaboración D. mantas, chompas realizando macramé, el prestamo a servido para poder comprar material en cantidad y poder acumular D. productos para ser vendidos en Navidad y D. esta manera  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The APOSTOL SANTIAGO enterprising bank has been cooperating with our institution for 8 cycles, since 1997. This group is characterized by the fact that most of its members are merchants of beauty products, food supplies, and clothing. The group has grown cohesively and has become enterprising. JULIA has been with the group for a very long time and acts as its president; she sells food items at the minibus stops in the Chijini area. With the financing she was able to buy such things as oil, sugar, flour and pasta at wholesale to meet her demand. Julia has a large family and her orders have helped her improve her income. JAQUELINE is one of the founding members and currently acts as group secretary. She has a family of 3 members and she sells clothes in the city of La Paz. She travels as far as Yacuiba (on the border with Argentina) where she gets items like crockery and beauty items. With financing from the institution she was able to increase her working capital and her earnings thereby improving her family's quality of life. ROSMERY has been with the group for a long time and acts as its treasurer. She is a craftsperson and makes macrame blankets and sweaters. The financing has served to buy materials in large quantities in order to accumulate items to be sold during the Christmas season thus improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital and inventory.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Mrs. Monina D. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, is married, and is blessed with seven adult children. Monina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years earning 3,000 PHP monthly from her business. In 2006, Monina joined PMPC to access its programs and services. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: La señora Priscila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Priscila, se dedica a la venta de queso,  hace 4 años atrás y nos cuenta que se iniciaron juntamente con su esposo con un capital de S/. 300.00 y trabajaban con pedidos anticipados de sus clientes. Actualmente, se encuentra mas establecida. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos como: cuajos de leche, limón en kilos, sal y algunos moldes para sus quesos y tercios de leña. Priscila, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  las demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante y brindarle una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Priscila is a member of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank, in the Eslabon District, Huallaga Province, San Martín Department. She is married, 43 years old, and is the mother of two children who still depend on her. She sells cheese. She tells us that 4 years ago she and her husband started this business with PEN 300.00 by taking advance orders from their customers. Now they are more established. With this loan of PEN 1,000.00 she will buy ingredients such as: milk coagulating enzymes, kilos of limes, salt, some molds for the cheese, and firewood. Priscilia is satisfied with the work she does. Though it is hard work, she believes it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill her dreams and the goals she has set out for herself. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing support to her and to other women who want to have success and a peaceful life when they are elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making her cheeses.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de anticuchos, negocio por la cual se hizo conocida, de esta manera hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de Comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Los Diamantes" community bank in the district of Eslabon, province of Bellavista, department of San Martin. She is unmarried, 45-years-old, and is the mother of two children, one of which still depends on her while they are in school. Rosita, as she is affectionately known, previously made a name for herself by being a vendor of kebabs called "anticuchos." In the same way, she now sells food out of her own home, a well-equipped place, where she attends her customers and guests. She tells us that her daily sales are good due to the delicious flavor she gives her food. She is well-known and very welcoming. These days, she maintains the same business and is very happy with her day to day work. It is Rosa who personally serves her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan of 1,500 soles ($525) to buy ingredients for the preparation of her daily foods, such as kilos of rice, liters of oil, crates of chickens, vegetables, and also some utensils - all that will go towards better serving her customers. She feels very fulll of life, and with her desire to keep moving ahead, she has many goals and dreams for her life, such as opening her own well-stocked grocery store. And, at the same time, she would also like to thank the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Griselda
