texts.es: La señora Griselda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabón, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 51 años y es madre de 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Griselda, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Griselda, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Griselda belongs to the “Los Diamantes” community bank in the district of Eslabón, province of Huallaga, department of San Martín. She is 51-years-old, has a domestic partner, and is the mother of 5 children, all of whom live on their own. Griselda is a woman who enjoys working, therefore she decided to open her own business selling carbonated soft drinks located in a well-equipped part of her home. She oversees the business on her own behalf without a schedule or supervisor. She says that she started out with 300.00 soles and began by buying 5 packs of soda; she saw that things were going well but that she lacked more soda, so, little by little, she began investing more. Nowadays, she maintains the same business and is well-known by her customers. This loan of 2,000.00 soles ($700) will be used to buy more beverages, such as soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Griselda has many goals for her future, and she feels very motivated to put her plans into action. She is grateful that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave her help when she most needed it, and she responsibly makes her payments and plans to continue doing so.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packs of soda

loans.name: Elda

texts.es: La señora Elda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabón, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Lleva 01 año, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. También, Elda cuenta con un fundo, ubicada a 02 kilómetros de la Ciudad, donde cría sus animales, como chanchos, gallinas y cuenta también con una piscigranja, donde cría sus peces. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos y vitaminas, para sus animales. Elda, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Elda is a member of the “Los Diamantes” community bank in the district of Eslabón, province of Bellavista, department of San Martín. She is married, 55-years-old, and the mother of two grown children. For one year, she has been providing urban transportation services in her motorcar. In order to do this work, her husband takes care of moving about the different places in the city. Her start came with her first Manuela Ramos loan, and little by little she was able to begin saving, and this money went to buy spare parts in order to better serve the inhabitants in her community. Also, Elda has a farm located 2 kilometers outside the city, where she raises her animals, among them pigs and chickens. It also contains a fish farm, where she raises her fish. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles ($1050), she plans to buy parts and oils, such as lubricants, and spark plugs in order to provide much better service and care to her customers. Part of the money will also be invested in buying feed and vitamins for her animals. Elda states that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights and make it so they are all respected. She is grateful that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos has helped her begin her faming venture.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts to improve her transportation service

loans.name: Lisenia

texts.es: La señora Lisenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabón, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza de gallinas, se amino a convertir esto en un negocio y lleva 12 años, obteniendo hasta ahora muy buenos resultados, por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para criar a sus animales.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 comprará gallinas ponedoras de huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Lisenia belongs to the “Los Diamantes” communal bank, in Eslabón District, San Martín Department. She is married, 29 years old, and the mother of 3 children who still depend on her. Motivated by her experience with raising chickens, she decided to turn this into a business, which she has had for 12 years. She has had good results, which is why she has continued with this business to the present. She has her business at her own house and it is well set up for raising her animals. With this loan of PEN 1,500.00, she will buy: egg laying hens, vitamins, and also chicken feed by the sack to keep the birds healthy and fat and more productive. She feels very happy and appreciative because of the support and service that Movimiento Manuela Ramos provides and for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead in life. She hopes that they will be able to continue with this work for a long time and that they’ll help many more families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Elmira

texts.es: La señora Rosa Elmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Comidas y lleva 12 años en el negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Elmira is a member of the communal bank called Los Diamantes (The Diamonds), located in the Eslabon District of Huallaga in San Martin. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children who attend school. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, has been preparing and selling meals for the last 12 years. She runs her business from her home, where she set up a small restaurant to serve her customers. Rosa is well known and liked, and her daily business is good thanks to the delicious meals she prepares. She is very content with the work she does each day, personally attending to her customers with the charisma she is known for. With this loan, she will purchase more of the ingredients she uses each day, such as rice, oil, chickens, vegetables, as well as some utensils to provide better service to her customers. Rosa feels full of energy and is motivated to continue working towards her goal of having her own well stocked grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the support they provide to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her small restaurant business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 46 años y 06 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos y lleva 05 años en el negocio, ubicada al frente de la Plaza, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.Carmen, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women) Community Bank, located in the Bellavista district of the Bellavista province of the Department of San Martin. This single 46 year old woman is the mother of 6 children, 1 of whom she still supports. She has always been characterized by her spirit of perseverance and her desire to progress through her own efforts. This has lead her to open her own business selling kebabs - something she has done for 5 years. Her business is located in the front of the Plaza in a well placed spot with good foot traffic. Little by little she endeared herself to her customers, and now she reports a strong business. Currently she continues in the same business, and she is very pleased with her job. With this 2,000 sol loan she will purchase basic ingredients including bags of rice, eggs, Creole chickens for making “juanes” (traditional Peruvian dish of cassava, rice, and meat steamed in a banana leaf), and cooking utensils so that she can provide high quality service and replace her old ones. Carmen feels pleased and at ease with what she is doing, and she is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing toward the completion of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
Belarmina M. is from the village of Bonbonon, a barangay of Iligan City on the island of Mindanao. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. Belarmina grows a variety of vegetables to sell like okra, string beans and eggplant. She has been farming for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Belarmina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services (this will be Belarmina's second loan from HSPFI). She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through this loan to grow her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas por las mañanas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa . Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente les deleita con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Bellavista, in the San Martín area. She is a 45-year-old widow and the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. In order to generate her own income for the household, she got the idea of opening a small business to sell food in the mornings in the air-conditioned environment of her own home. Today, she has gained a lot of experience in this type of activity and she has made herself known and loved by her customers. Currently, she continues with the same business, tending to her customers who visit her daily and she herself delights them with her culinary gift and her friendliness. With this loan of S/ 2,500.00, she will buy rice, sugar, sacks of potatoes, various vegetables, eggs and chicken. She will also buy kitchen utensils in order to replace those that she currently has and therefore be able to provide better service and attention to her customers. Juanita, as they affectionately call her, feels very confident and desires to continue with her business and ensure a peaceful life for herself. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma E. is from the village of Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Elma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $153 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Elma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Pictured here with her husband is Ouk S.. She is 44 years old and they have four children. They live in Phnom Penh City. Three of her children are enrolled in a local high school.

To make a living, she is employed as a servant at her neighbor’s house, earning an income of $2.60 per day. Her husband's job as a police officer at the interior ministry brings in $6 per day and is the family's primary source of income. To help cover the household expenses, one of her children is working at a restaurant as a waiter.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work easily. By doing this, S. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn P. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Junalyn owns and operates a business selling mineral water in the local community. Junalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Junalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Junalyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Karol

texts.es: La señora Karol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 hijo.Karol, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados, hoy en día vende accesorios de computadoras.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará accesorios como: redes, cables,   usb, mouse inalámbricos, impresoras y pc’s, en diferentes marcas, asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Karol, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Karol belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 27-years-old and is the mother of one child. Karol is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life. Her desire to carry on has produced good results. Today, she sells computer accessories. With this loan of S/ 1,700.00, she will buy accessories such as mains, cables, USB cords, wireless mice, printers and PCs of different brands as well as another display case to showcase her products. Karol is an example to follow for many woman who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start their own businesses and grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Roquina

texts.en:
Roquina T. is from the village of San Roque Barianut, Iligan City. She is 58 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Roquina owns and operates a business selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Roquina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $109 a month from these activities. In 2009, Roquina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Roquina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Roquina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S., age 64, has been in the farming business more than twenty-nine years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has three children. All of them are married and are still living together in the family home.

One of her daughters, who is pictured, works as a garment worker and gives her small income to the family. Mom S. also earns additional profit from selling silk skirts, and she is taking out her first loan in order to accrue a larger number of silk skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large number of silk skirts to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen L., 24, is married and lives in Phnom Penh City with her husband. She is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of meatballs near her home. Also, she is a skillful tailor who sews shorts and trousers for wholesale to her new and existing customers, earning an income of US$7 per day.

The family is assisted mainly by her husband who provides laundry services to the people in his village, earning an income of US$2 per day to help cover the household expenses.

L. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fabrics to expand her current business of sewing. She hopes that her business plan will enable her family to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina M. is from the village of Bonbonon, Iligan City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Tiene varios años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.Anita, como le dicen de cariño nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 42-years-old and is the mother of 3 children, one of whom still depends on her. She has spent several years selling gutted chickens. She is located in the central market of her town. She began with the first loan from Manuela Ramos, selling a few chickens. Soon she was well-received and had regular customers. Thus, she continued to excel and now she sells chickens in abundance. Currently, she continues with the same business in a rented stall at the central market, where she offers service to the residents of the community and housewives. With this loan of S/ 3,000.00, she will buy chickens in crates and she will invest part of the money in the purchase of new tools such as a digital scale and new knives to replace the ones she has now. Today, she is an independent woman and she is the one who manages and makes decisions regarding her business. Anita, as they affectionately call her, tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to know her rights better and together they make sure that they are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy chickens in crates.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely C. is from Iligan City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Ely owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mily

texts.es: La señora Mily, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con un capital de S/. 1,000.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mily belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 37-years-old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. Motivated by the need to earn income for her household, she started a small business selling groceries with a loan of S/ 1,000.00 and got very good results from the outset due to the quality of her products, her affordable prices and her good customer service. Currently, she continues to run the same business from her own home, where her main customers are her neighbors. With this loan of S/ 3,000.00, she will buy more products for variety such as rice and sugar by the kilo, cartons of eggs, products for the bathroom and cleaning the house, packets of soft drinks, sweets and other products to keep her clientele happy. Today, she feels very content with the work and service that she provides and she thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and advance. She hopes that they can continue doing so for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to increase the number of products.

loans.name: Khly

texts.en:
Khly T. is a 31-year-old woman who has been selling a few fresh fish around the community. As another income source, she raises a few pigs in a stall behind her house.

Khly T. is married to Em Heap, 31, who is shown in the photo because Khly T. was busy with her business. He owns a horse and cart for providing a taxi service to earn a living. This couple has three kids who attend the local public school.

Khly T. thinks that her pig-raising business is a profitable one and the main way for her to supplement her family's income. She decided to seek a 500 USD loan which she will use to buy pig feed and a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda E. is from the village of Mabuhay in Iligan  City. She is 44 years old. Emmalinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emmalinda sells charcoal made from coconut shells in the local community. Emmalinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emmalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase new items to sell. Emmalinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Emmalinda's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom D., age 40, is married and has three school-aged children. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and children. To make a living, she rents out part of her house, which earns her an income of US $3.30 per day. The family is supported mainly by her husband who drives a tuk-tuk (a motorbike with an attached riding compartment). Together, they earn US $15 per day, which is the family's primary source of income and helps to pay for all household expenses. 

D. and her family want to improve their standard of living. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children, so he can commute to school easily. By doing this, D. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

D.'s husband appears in the accompanying photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to school

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: L. señora Elva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y 03 hijos, que aun depenD. D. elL..Lleva 14 años dedicándose a este tipo D. actividad, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller D. confección D. vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para L. costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo D. ManueL. Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente.Uno D. sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar mas su taller D. confección con maquinas industriales modernas.En L. actualidad continua con sus confecciones D. ropas y tiene una clienteL. ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su taller para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es elL. quien personalmente les atienD.  con L. amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. Elva, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento ManueL. Ramos por ayudarL. a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Elva belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She is married, is 44-years-old and has 3 children who still depend on her. She has spent 14 years working at this type of business and little by little, she began to generate her own income and save her money. She has wanted to set up her dressmaking shop and has an aptituD. for sewing. She didn't hesitate to do it and with the support of ManueL. Ramos, she decided to start her own business at a well-equipped location in order to cater to customers. She tells us that sales are going well for her and she works with advance customer orders. One of her dreams and goals that she wants to achieve is to outfit her sewing shop with modern industrial machines. Currently, she is still making clothes and has a faithful customer base who come daily to her shop with work requests. She is the one who personally tends to them with her customary kindness. With this loan of S/ 1,500.00, she will buy meters of fabric of different types, instruments such as scissors, sewing and mechanical needles, pins and buttons. Today, Elva feels like an accomplished woman who wants to reach for her dreams and make them a reality. She thanks the Movimiento ManueL. Ramos for helping her start her business and also for helping many women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena N. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Lorena is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lorena sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Lorena's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po R., age 41, is single and resides in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she is employed at a tailor shop, earning an income of US $3.30 per day. She is skilled in sewing tradtional Cambodian clothes. She has been involved in this business since 2006. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. R. and her family members want improve their standard of living, so R. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her younger brother and sister to commute to school more easily. By doing this, R. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her siblings to commute to school

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: La señora Milagros, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun depende de ella.Milagros, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Milagros, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Señora Milagros belongs to the communal bank "Active Women," an affiliate of Kiva in the District of Bellavista, province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She is married, 29 years old, and the mother of three children that depend on her. Milagros is a woman who likes to work, so she decided to open her own soft drinks business located in her house, in a very well located area. She is the administrator of her business, without a having a schedule or a boss. She started with 300 S. and began buying six packages of drinks, but they sold very well and she could have sold more, but little by little she invested in more. Currently, she continues in this same business, but she is already known by her clients. With this loan of 1,000 S., she will buy soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands, like mineral water and bottled water. Milagros has many goals in front of her and feels motivated by her proposal. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed it most, and is responsible with her repayment to them, and will continue to be responsible in paying back her loans..

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela has owned and managed a mini-canteen for a long time. Her canteen has been her way of helping her husband to provide for the needs of their children. Angela sells different kinds foods in their village. She is now borrowing PHP 8,000 from the KIVA lenders to buy cooking ingredients and improve her business. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can also meet the demands of her customers. 

Angela is 40 years old and married. She is blessed with five children. They live in the village of San Isidro in Ilagan, Isabela. Angela and her supportive husband dream of improving their living condition and experiencing a more comfortable life. They hope that, through their business, they will able to achieve what they have only dreamed.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Valvena

texts.en:
Valvena P. is from the village of Manticao in Misamis  Oriental. She is 48 years old. Valvena is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Valvena sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Valvena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Valvena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Valvena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Valvena is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Valvena's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way.” says Lydia, a businesswoman who is doing everything to help her husband to improve their family's living conditions. She is married and blessed with four children who are all married college graduates. Even though they have their own families, she still helps them.

Lydia sells different kinds of snacks, fruits and vegetables. She also ventured into a direct-sales business (selling directly to customers from a catalog of products) for additional income. For 12 years, she never grown tired of working to meet the needs of her children. She has been selling different commodities in their village and she is earning an amount sufficient for her family’s needs. 

Lydia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to develop her business. She will use the loan in purchasing more vegetables to sell. She also plans to purchase more products from MSE Cosmetics and Board Walk for her direct-sales business. She hopes that her loan will be granted because it will contribute a lot to the development of her business.

loans.use: Addtional capital to purchase more vegetables and to expand her direct-sales business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns and operates a general store in front of her family's house in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She has been managing her business for two years and her business has provided for the basic needs of their family and paid for her children to attend school. She hopes to expand her retailing business by adding merchandise that she can sell in her store.  

Mary is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve and develop her general store. She will use the loan to buy more items that she can offer to her customers. The loan will surely be a big help in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem N., 23, is married and resides in Phnom Penh with her husband. She is currently employed in a local garment factory and earns an income of US $3.00 per day. Their family is supported mainly by her husband who is a construction foreman in the city. He earns US $5 per day, which is the primary source of income for the family and helps to pay for their household expenses. 

N. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cement so her husband can finish building his customer’s house.

N.'s husband appears in the accompanying photograph.

loans.use: To buy cement to finish a construction job

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth S. is from the village of Manticao in Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Janeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth buys and sells coconut for "copras," the dried coconut meat from which coconut oil is extracted. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP each month.

In 2008, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to buy new items to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Janeth's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An S., 32, is a married man who works as a construction worker. He and his wife have been living in a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years.

They wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of river, and then fish. Once they finish, they hurry to bring their fish to the market to sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect money after their buyers finish selling the fish.

Recently, they haven't been able to catch as many fish as before because some of their fishing equipment has been ruined. Therefore, An S. is applying for a loan to repair the old equipment and to also buy more equipment.

loans.use: To repair old fishing equipment and to buy more equipment

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La señora Roció, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 31 años, es madre de 02 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.Se inicio en la venta de pescado seco hace 8 años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,5000.00, comprara pescado seco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Rocio is a member of the Active Women Communal Bank, which is in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. She is the mother of two dependent children who attend school. Eight years ago, Rocio began selling dried fish with an initial investment of 300 soles in hopes of supporting her family financially. The money was invested well, since her business continues to this day but with a greater variety of fish in larger quantities.

With this loan of 2500 soles, Rocio will purchase dried fish by the kilo that was produced in the region and also comes from the coast of the country. The variety of fish she will acquire includes bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and pejerey. This will keep her business well-stocked and enable her to satisfy the discerning tastes of her customers. Rocio expressed that she is happy to be part of a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties through the years because she is now able to face challenges with tremendous strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried fish

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa O. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Nerissa is married and has three grown children. Nerissa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Nerissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nerissa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet T., 26, is married and resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and their two-year old child. To make a living, she sells various kinds of vegetables at a local market, earning an income of US $3 per day. (She is pictured at her vegetable stand at a local market.)

T.'s husband is an electrician in the city, and together they earn an income of US $4 per day. T. and her family are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, T. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more vegetables to expand her business and to replace her old unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale and to replace her old motorbike.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma F. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Emma is married and has eight school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear items to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Ngin S. is 54 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Ngin S. makes a living planting crops in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for years. Ngin S. has given birth to five children, three of whom are married and live away from home. Her two school-aged children live with her and work on the farm when they are free from studying. 

This harvest season, Ngin S. is applying for a loan to use as capital to buy rice in bulk from the rice growers. She will sell the rice when it commands a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from the growers, to sell when the rice is commanding a good price.

loans.name: Deysi Fiorela

texts.es: La señora Deysi Fiorela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.Tiene 09 años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.Deysi Fiorela: nos cuenta que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Deysi Fiorela, 34, is a member of the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still dependent on her. For the last 9 years she has sold dressed chickens in her municipal Central Market. She began with her first Manuela Ramos loan, selling just a few chickens. With time, she was well received and acquired major customers. Thus, she continued to improve and now she sells large quantities of chickens. She currently is in the same line of work in a rented space in the Central Market where she provides service to area residents and housewives. With this 3000 sol loan she plans to buy live, caged chickens and part of the money will be used to buy new tools like a digital scale and new knives to replace the ones she has now. Today, she is an independent woman for she alone makes business-related decisions. Daysi Fiorela tells us that being part of a group of women has helped her to know her rights and together to see that they are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Visitacion is married and has one grown child. Visitacion owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 39, is married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local high school. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, her husband is engaged in a business as a Tuk Tuk driver (a motorbike with a compartment attached), earning collectively an income of US $10 per day. He operates his business every day at a local market in the city. This primary source of income helps cover his household expense. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to replace his old unreliable motorbike so that her husband will be able to operate his business efficiently.

loans.use: To replace the old motorbike

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda M. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Hilda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Hilda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling Ready To Wear items in the local community. Hilda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Hilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Dolibeth

texts.es: La señora Dolibeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas por las mañanas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa . Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente les deleita con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Dolibeth, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Dolibeth belongs to the communal bank "Active Women" in the district of Bellavista, Bellavista province, in the Department of San Martín. She is married, is 34 years old, and is the mother of two children who are still dependent on her. With the goal of generating her own income in her home, she had the idea to open a small business selling food in the mornings in the very comfortable environment of her own home. Today, she has gained a lot of experience in this type of activity and she has become well know and loved by her customers. She is currently continuing with this same business, serving customers who come daily to her premises, and it is she who personally delights them with her delicious flavors and her characteristic kindness. With this loan of $700 she will by rice, sugar, and potatoes in sacks, various vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace those she currently has and thus provide better service and attention to her customers. Dolibeth, as she is called with affection, feels very secure and eager to move forward and attain a quiet life for herself. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for making meals to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita D. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Lita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta has been engaged in the piggery business for two years. She purchases hogs and raises them in her pigpen situated at the back of their house. She also raises native pigs, which are black in color.  Violeta is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 that she needs to purchase medicine and a feed supply for her hogs because they can consume at least ten kilos of feed a day.  She hopes that her request will be granted for her business to grow and support the needs of their family. 

Violeta is already a widow and left with six children. Most of them are still studying.  Together with her children, they live a simple life in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and feed for her hogs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarah Lyn

texts.en:
Sarah Lyn B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Sarah Lyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah Lyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sarah Lyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sarah Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah Lyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarah Lyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. has been a fish vendor in her village for the past year. She usually purchases her products in the public market of Cauayan, Isabela, and then sells them at retail prices. Lina is married and she resides with her husband in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She hopes that through their mutual cooperation, they can survive life’s difficulties and uplift their living condition. 

Lina is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to expand her retail business. She plans to increase her merchandise by having more kilos of fish available for sale in her village. She believes that in this way, her business will become profitable and she will be able to provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: For the expansion of her retail fish business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda E. runs a poultry business in her village. She has been in business for four years. She has already sold some of the grown chicks and is now raising another batch of chicks.

Merlinda is hoping to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to purchase food and medicine needed for the chicks' growth. She hopes that her loan will be granted so she can pursue her business plans.

Merlinda is 36 years old and a diligent business woman. She is married and gifted with one child. Her husband operates a passenger tricycle in their village as another source of income for their family. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting, her business will continue to grow and her family will have a more comfortable way of life.

loans.use: To purchase food and medicine for her poultry business.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion R. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old. Asuncion is married and has seven grown children. Asuncion owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion A. is married and blessed with four children, who are all students. They live in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Consolacion's husband works on the farm, while she manages a hog-raising business. They dream that their children will finish their college education.

Consolacion wants to improve her business. In order to pursue her plans, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she will use to buy additional piglets to raise.

In her one year in this business, she has already had profits. The additional income was quite helpful in meeting her family’s needs. She wants to improve her income so that she can better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 47 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual el mismo confecciona artesanalmente en su taller. Los modelos que diseña son muy novedosos y llamativos, motivo por el cual las personas prefieren comprarle a él.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, ya que es una actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeño de su madre, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los fardos de ropa hasta su puesto de venta. 
Para más adelante, espera poder comprar más máquinas de tejer, con las cuales pueda producir en mayor cantidad sus prendas artesanales.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Antonio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y quiere hacerlo, aunque para eso tenga que trabajar más duro, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más lana, con la cual pueda producir más prendas.
texts.en:
Antonio, 47, is a very hard-working man. He lives alone in his own house and what he most desires is to get ahead in life. His place of business is located in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (place where the city of Juliaca has its fairs). He sells clothing which he himself makes in his workshop. His designs are very novel and showy, reason enough for people to prefer to buy from him. What he most likes about his job is the weaving which he learned as a child from his mother. He has been doing this for 16 years and the most difficult part of the job is moving the bundles of clothing from the workshop to the sales stand. He hopes in the future to be able to buy more knitting machines so that he can produce better quality crafts. This is Antonio's fourth loan with MFP. He knows that he must repay in time and wants to do so even if that means having to work even harder. He is a very well-liked member of his communal bank. He will use the 2,000 soles to buy more wool with which to produce more items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es:
Jonatan, de 21 años es un joven muy trabajador y carismático, vive en la casa de su madre y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante en su vida.

El tejido artesanal es la actividad que desempeñó desde muy pequeño para ayudar a su madre con al economía del hogar, y actualmente gracias al arduo trabajo y a los ahorros que pudieron realizar compraron una combi, con la cual trabaja haciendo transporte de pasajeros, él es el conductor y con esta actividad logra conseguir el dinero para ayudar a su madre.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conducir, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 3 realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día ya que tiene que cumplir con el número de vueltas a la ruta que le exige la empresa donde está asociada su combi. 
Para el futuro, espera poder comprar otra combi y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Jonatan con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y de ser responsable con el resto de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para la confección de tejidos artesanales, ya que su mamá todavía continua trabajando en ello.
texts.en:
Jonatan, 21, is a charismatic, hard-working young man. He lives in his mother's house and is willing to work very hard to get ahead in life. He has worked from childhood as a craftsperson weaving to help his mother with household expenses. Thanks to hard work and savings they were able to buy a minibus with which he transports passengers; he is the driver. With this work he is able to earn income to help his mother. What he likes most about his work is the driving since it's entertaining. He has done this for three years and feels that the most difficult part of the job is having to work all day to meet the number of trips on his route that the company his minibus is associated with insists on. He hopes to be able to buy another minibus in the future to improve his income. This is Jonatan's fourth loan with MFP and he is firmly commited not to falter with his repayments and to be responsible with the other members of the communal bank. With the 2,000 soles requested he will buy more wool for the woven crafts since his mother still works at this.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his mother's business.

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es:
Lenin, de 27 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila y digna.

El trabajo que realiza le da los ingresos necesario para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, él es conductor de su propia combi, con la cual recorre la ruta número 12 de transporte urbano por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene muchos clientes y es que lleva mucho tiempo, trabajando en esta ruta, por lo cual conoce muy bien a las personas que viven cerca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente su combi por las calles en busca de clientes, ya lleva 10 años realizando en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es arreglar el carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. 
Para el futuro, anhela tener un negocio más rentable tal vez un taller mecánico.

Es el quinto préstamo de Lenin con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es uno de los pocos varones y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los mil soles solicitados hará arreglar el motor de su carro, ya que por el paso del tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Lenin, 27, is a hard-working young man. He lives in his parents' house and what he most desires in life is to provide them with a dignified and peaceful old age. To earn income to help his family with household expenses he is the driver of his own minibus. He covers urban route #2 in the city of Juliaca.
