Mohira K. lives in the Rumy region. She's forty years old, married and has six children. Her husband works in the local tax office. For the past fifteen years Mohira has sold clothes on the market. She is asking for a loan in order to buy new products and increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Wava Muno Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Christine N. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hard working lady who is married with a one-year-old child.  She also takes care of other orphans.

Christine has been operating a salon in Seeta for two years now and she is able to make 50,000 Ugandan shillings (about $27 U.S.) in profit per week. She is a good person with good customer care and her hope is to expand her salon further as well as her family having good health. Christine hopes this loan will boost her salon business enough so that she will be able to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and hair pieces for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem M. is a villager in Prakeab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she also raises pigs.

Since her pig-raising business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more pigs and pig feed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Noem M. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy five more pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim S. is a villager in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare (1.25-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. 

Now, Mrs. Khim S. is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Khim S. is the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because this child is only two years old. Her husband, Mr. Loeng Chhorn, is a construction worker and he is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: This is Alicia G., 60 years old and the mother of six. She lives with her grandchildren in the poor neighborhood in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. For seven years now, Alicia has been attending to her general store located in front of her house, using much of her profits to support her grandchildren’s education. Her store gives her a net income of P10,000 a month. Alicia is now on her 14th loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She has applied for a new loan of P16,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell at her store. Alicia wants to see her general store in the future to be bigger than it is now so that she can help employ some of her neighbors. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Evatha

texts.en:
Evatha F. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a food shop at Yombo Makangarawe district in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells a variety of food crop products at her shop including maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She has been in the business for five years and her business revenue helps her to meet her daily needs.

Evatha needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Haem Preoung, is a motorbike repairer who is able to make a small income to support the family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family and build their house. In order to build their house, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more equipment to build the house.

Mrs. Mom S. has five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers and more equipment to build their house

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. SopH. H. is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Seong Da, is a driver who is able to make a small income to support the family.

Although they work very hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. Thus, Mrs. SopH. H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. SopH. H. is the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for two borrowers. The leader, Mrs. Sum S., age 49, has been selling groceries since early 2008. She lives with her child and her husband in a small family home located in Kampong Chhnang Province. To help meet the family's needs, her husband drives a motorbike taxi.

Sum S. requests a loan to use as additional capital for her grocery business.

The other borrower, Mrs. Min S., is a vegetable seller who is requesting a loan to begin a business raising pigs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is a villager in Trapeang S. village in Takeo province. She sells items such as grocery products, vegetables, food, and so on.

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. Srey S. wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to resell to earn more income.

Mrs. Srey S. has three children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Khy Nhorn, is a soldier. He is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more goods to resell

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: T. Yvette est née le 23 Octobre 1961 et vit depuis huit ans déjà au quartier Gbèdjromédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Yvette est une célibataire ayant à sa charge deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Yvette supporte seule les charges de la famille. Yvette a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux des enfants qui sont à sa charge, Yvette vend des lubrifiants à Cotonou. Yvette achète ses articles à la société SONACOP à Cotonou. Il y a de cela 10 ans déjà que Yvette mène cette activité. Yvette n'a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Yvette sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier crédit.
texts.en:
T. Yvette was born on October 23, 1961 and has been living for eight years in the Gbèdjromédé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is unmarried and has two children in her care. One of them is in school.  She is the sole support for the family. Yvette stopped going to classes in secondary school.  To support herself and her children, who are in her care, she sells lubricants in Cotonou. She buys her goods at the SONACOP company in Cotonou.  She has been running this business for ten years already.  She has never obtained an ALIDé loan before.  To bolster her business and to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lubricants

loans.name: Realiza

texts.en: Realiza G. is a 38 year old businesswoman. She lives in Tala, Caloocan City with her husband Romeo, 44, a painter, and their four children. Realiza has been a hog-meat and dressed-chicken vendor for years and has a stall in the nearby public market. Her net income is P8,000 a month. Realiza came from a poor family but she believes that there is always a way to get out of poverty. In the latter part of 2007, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and has carefully invested the proceeds of her previous loans in her business. It went well and brought her enough additional income to cover her family’s daily needs including her children’s education. However, she laments that unstable farm-gate prices of livestock and poultry, due to the recent typhoons and floods, affects her business so much. Now on her 7th loan, Realiza is requesting P12,000 and will use the funds as additional capital for her dressed chicken and hog meat stand. She is optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty as she slowly feels the progress of her business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-meat and dressed-chicken business

loans.name: Mutabarhon

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мутабархон проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 44 года. замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Мутабархон более 12 лет занимется торговлей на рынке, она в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
A. Mutabarhon lives in Rumi. She is 33 years old and married, with three children. Her husband is in Russia earning money. Mutabarhon herself has been trading on the market for over 12 years, chiefly in groceries. She asks for a loan in order to increase the turnover of the goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the turnover of the goods she sells

loans.name: Zinabala Nasuuti Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Mukwenda N. is a determined and hard-working lady and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 52 years old and a widow with six children, three of whom are in school. Mukwenda also helps to take care of her siblings.

Mukwenda’s business is farming as well as selling farm produce from Kasangalabi for ten years. She makes 70,000 UGX a week. This has enabled her to save for her children’s education and more farm property.

Mukwenda dreams of increasing her profits by having more land to farm. At the moment, Mukwenda is requesting a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Akinyi

texts.en:
Elizabeth has an open-air stand in the Kisumu market where she sells bed linens including blankets, comforters, bedcovers and sheets. Her location is busy but she is challenged when it rains or is scorching hot. She also deals with a great deal of competition. In addition to the bed linens, she has another stand selling children's clothes. Her ultimate business goal is to have a boutique in downtown Kisumu.

Elizabeth is married and has one daughter in lower primary school. She is hardworking and ambitious and dreams of building a big house and educating her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more bedcovers, comforters, blankets and nets to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Z. Justine est née en 1976 et réside au quartier Sainte Cécile à Cotonou depuis environs 10 ans. Mariée à HOUNYE Félix, Justine est mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Justine a arrêté très tôt l'école, et depuis près de douze ans, elle mène comme activité, la vente d'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) et également de maïs dans son quartier. Justine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine a déjà obtenu deux crédits de Alidé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Justine sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer et augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Z. Justine was born in 1976 and has been residing for about ten years in the district of Sainte Cécile in Cotonou.  Married to HOUNYE Félix, Justine is the mother of three children, not all of whom are in school.  Justine left school very early on and since then has been running a business for twelve years selling akassa (a local food made with corn starch) and also corn in her district.  She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has obtained two ALIDé loans before, which she has repaid.  She's requesting a third ALIDé loan for bolstering and increasing her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorphea S. is a villager in Trapeang Saom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.1-hectare (.25-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Um Neara, is a construction worker who is able to make a small income to support the family. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Since her husband’s work place is far from home, Mrs. Sorphea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

Mrs. Sorphea S. is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger V. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and is single.Roger owns and operates a business venture in services sector.While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing "habal-habal" or motorcycle services to local community members. He has also income from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Roger joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair the motorcycle used in his business.

Roger is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts and portion of the loan finance for his corn production. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Roger from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spareparts/corn production

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana M., 33 years old, is from Camarin, a barangay of northern Caloocan City on Luzon Island. She is in the business of direct sales of cosmetics, accessories, and other health products she gets from prominent direct-sales companies. She has been in business for three years now and earns more than 5,000 PHP a month.

Being a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative has helped Ana’s business grow. She is now on her fifth loan cycle. Ana is applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP as additional capital for her business.

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics, products and accessories for her direct-sales business.

loans.name: Tutihon

texts.ru: Курбанова Тутихон проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 57 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Тутихон более 25 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Муж работает "таксистом". Тутихон просит кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Tutihon K. lives in the Rumy district. She is 57 years old. She is married with three children. Tutihon has worked in animal husbandry for more than 25 years. She fattens and sells oxen. Her husband is a taxi driver. Tutihon is asking for a loan to purchase an ox.

Translated from Russian by Amanda Ross, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ox

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a thirty-eight-year-old divorced mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Akosua is a food vendor, preparing and a local dish called banku (cooked dough) which is served hot with soup. She buys her materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en: Amorlina U. is from the village of Olingan. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Amorlina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Amorlina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Amorlina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn C. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Merlyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn plants and harvests corn for sale. Merlyn has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon L. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Corazon is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business providing wood lamination services to local community members. Corazon has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which, will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Corazon from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 35 years old and divorced with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Patience is in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. 

Patience has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the village of Pobalcion 3, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites provides van transportation in the local community. Marites has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to improve her transportation services with the purchase of spare parts of the vehicle. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marites from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her transportation service van

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is a 34-year-old married mother of four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of residents practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Mavis is a trader. She trades in corn dough and cassava dough. She sells at the market square and also supplies to food vendors in her community. Mavis buys her materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and cassava in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and cassava

loans.name: Mahfiratkhon

texts.ru: Махфиратхон Собирчонова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 57 лет. Вдова, имеет 6 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Махфирахон более 30 лет занимается животноводством, она откармливает и продает скот. У нее имеются постоянные клиенты, мясники. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Mahfiratkhon S. lives in the district of Rumi. She is 57-year-old widow with six children. Her oldest son is working in Russia. Mahfiratkhon has been a livestock breeder for over 30 years and has established relationships with clients. She raises and sells livestock. She is asking for a loan to purchase additional animals.

Translated from Russian by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 47, is married with six children between the ages of 20 and 30 years old. Two of her children go to school. Rose resides in, and owns, a nine room house where she is staying with six people. Rose also takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. 

Rose incurs transport costs to and from buying local gin from districts of Kasese, Kyenjojo and Fort portal in southwestern Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Rose works seven days a week. She receives an average of 15 customers a day and sells to all kinds of people, but on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of local gin (alcohol) and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her because she works in a muddy area. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  She has been in this business for her 30th loan. Rose joined MCDT beacuse it was near her home and was easy to work with it.She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of alcohol (local gin) She aspires to see her business grow and to be able to start distributing to different shops in and around Kampala.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local brew

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mary is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her inventory. Mary desires to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Christiana is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her inventory. Christiana desires to give her children the best  education she can afford.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 35, is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 10 years old. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a one room house where she is staying with six people. Esther also takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. 

Esther incurs transport costs to and from buying ground nuts from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She moves door to door after frying ground nuts in Kampala city. She uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Esther works seven days a week .She receives an average of ten customers each day and sells to all kinds of people. Her major business challenges include the ever increasing prices of ground nuts and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her because she works in an open area. Her monthly expenses include rent for her residence, feeding the family and medication. 

She has been in this business for over twelve years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her fourth loan. Esther joined MCDT because it was near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy a sack of ground nuts. She aspires to see her business grow and to be able to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of ground nuts

loans.name: Daniel Omondi

texts.en:
Daniel Omondi is 27 years old, married to Claris, and the father of a boy who is two years old. Daniel operates a small shop, a business that he has had for 12 years. He started the business with capital he had raised through farming sweet potatoes on his small piece of land. He and his family are totally dependent on this business for their needs and so far he has not had a challenge.

Daniel was introduced to KADET Limited by a friend who was an existing client. This will be his third loan, and he intends to use the funds to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat, which are mostly demanded during the December festive season.

He aspires to open a wholesale business for household goods.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 29 years old. She is married and has a daughter who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Joyce is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure more provisions to increase her inventory. Joyce desires to give her daughter the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: A. Odette est née en 1956 et réside au quartier Houénoussou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis onze ans. C'est une veuve ayant cinq enfants tous scolarisés, mais dont trois sont à sa charge. Odette vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Odette n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Odette mène depuis onze ans comme activité, la vente de divers articles (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, liqueurs, tomate  en boîte, petits pois, lait, bougies, papiers hygiéniques, tomate, piments, etc.) à son domicile. Odette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Bohicon au Bénin. Odette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Odette voudrait diversifier davantage son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi, Odette sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Odette was born in 1956 and has been residing for 11 years in the Houénoussou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow with five children who are all in school. She is financially responsible for three of them. She lives alone with her children and is the sole breadwinner of the family. Odette never attended school. To support herself, she has been running a business out of her home for 11 years selling a variety of goods (pasta, canned food, liqueurs, canned tomatoes, peas, milk, candles, toilet paper, tomatoes, chili peppers, etc.) She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin, and in Bohicon in Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client, having already had two loans, which were repaid. She would like to diversify her business further and to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she's requesting a third ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap, pasta, cassava flour, and canned foods

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian Muthoni is a 32-year-old married mother of one child. She lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, with her husband Francis and son Martin. Lilian has been operating a tailoring shop in Shanzu for the last nine years and the business has been successful so far.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is glad to access her first loan. With the money, she plans to purchase materials for tailoring and to also purchase the electronics for an electronics shop she plans to put up in Shanzu to supplement her tailoring income. Lilian's main clients are the residents of Shanzu.

In future she hopes to expand her current business and diversify into other ventures that will increase her disposable income.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase materials for tailoring and to also purchase electronics

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 26 years old. He is married and has a daughter who is in school. He lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, a majority of the residents practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Samuel is a trader. He trades in fresh groundnuts. He supplies to retailers and food vendors in his community. He buys the groundnuts from nearby communities. Samuel has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts in bulk to expand his business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 25 years old. She is married and has a daughter who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Comfort is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more provisions to increase her inventory. Comfort desires to give her daughter the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn A. is from the village of Cawa-cawa. She is 26 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jonalyn owns and operates a business providing carpentry services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for her child's education in the future. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools needed to provide service

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 55 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, located in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. Augustina is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Augustina has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Cissy  Semanyi  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Cissy, 51, is married with two children between the ages of 4 and 9 years old. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with six people. Cissy also takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and gets three meals a day. 

Cissy incurs transport costs to and from buying second hand clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Cissy works six days a week .She receives an average of 15 customers a day and sells to all kinds of people but on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include the ever increasing prices of second hand clothes and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her because she works in a open place. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  

She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 20th loan. Cissy joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with MCDT. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both now in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Janet is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure more provisions to increase her stock. Janet desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.en:
Rahmatsho is 42 years old, married and has two children. He owns a small grocery store, which he first opened four years ago. His store is well known in the neighborhood due to the fact that Rahmatsho has been able to keep it well stocked because of loans received through the Kiva field partner, IMON International. He has plans to expand the store this winter, as he isn't currently able to display all his stock because of limited space. Rahmatsho tells us he's a fighter and that this line of work requires much sacrifice, as he must work everyday, including weekends, starting at 6 am and going well into the evening. In spite of this, he feels very fortunate to have his own business, to be able to support his family and to provide his children with a good education. Rahmatsho is requesting this loan to purchase meats, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, etc. Thank you! 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader. Helena runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure more provisions to increase her stock. Helena desires to give her daughter the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell in her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 50-year-old divorced woman with five children, who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Elizabeth is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Elizabeth has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Y. Ilhomjon is 24 years old. He is married and has a little child. Ilhomjon has a small place in the market where he sells all kinds of small items necessary for a household. He has been in this kind of business for four years. Ilhomjon wants his children to have a higher education, and that is why he is working hard together with his wife, who always assists him in everything. The business is successful, bringing considerable income to the family.

Today Ilhomjon wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. With this purpose he is requesting 4000 TJS. Having received a loan from IMON twice already, and having demonstrated himself as a reliable client, Ilhomjon promises to manage this loan with accuracy. loans.use: To expand his business by increasing the working capital to purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a trader. Esther trades in palm nuts. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and palm oil producers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Esther has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to seven children, all now in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Alice is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. Alice has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Ahad

texts.en:
N. Ahad turned 42 recently. He and his wife raised five children. During the last twenty years, Ahad has been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. His older son helps him in the business. Ahad is respected and well known in the neighborhood as a real master at his work, and that brings him a large clientele. The business is stable and generates the main income for the family. Ahad needs to purchase basic materials like wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies for his business. He is also planning to improve the working conditions at his business. For these reasons he asking to borrow $2000. Ahad thanks all lenders for supporting him and for their trust.

loans.use: To purchase wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a fifty-four-year-old divorced mother of four children. All of her children are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a farming as well as a commercial center in the region. Alice has a fish-selling business. She buys the smoked fish from nearby fishing communities. She hawks to sell in her community and also sells at the local market. Alice has been in the fish-selling business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: D. Honorine est née en 1974 et est mariée à VLAFONOU Martin, un chauffeur. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Seul Martin supporte les dépenses de la famille. Il y a seulement un an de cela que Honorine vit avec son mari au quartier Tonato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Honorine a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Il y a seulement un an que Honorine vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot) au domicile de ses parents à Cotonou. Honorine a déjà obtenu un premier crédit de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle avait bien remboursé. Honorine souhaite diverisifier son activité et l'agrandir davantage, c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Honorine was born in 1974 and is married to VLAFONOU Martin, a driver.  The couple still have no children.  Martin in the only one covering family expenses.  For just a year now, Honorine and her husband have been living in the district of Tonato in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Honorine stopped attending class in primary school.  She has been selling food (rice, beans) for a year out of her parents' home in Cotonou. She had an ALIDé loan before, which she had repaid.  She would like to diversify her business and to enlarge it further.  This is why she's requesting a second ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, beans, drums of oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
A. Said has worked in agriculture since he was young. He works even harder at it now because he has made his home with his wife and their four lovely children, whom he loves very much. Due to his high level of knowledge, Said takes full advantage of his parcels of land and also leaves them fallow sometimes so that the land will grow excellent products for him. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of $1000 to invest in seeds and mineral fertilizer for his crops (wheat and potatoes) and to take good care of his land. Said feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that his children can stay in school and have a bright future. Support this man of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en: Paterna A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is school-aged. Paterna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting root crops and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 1,400 PHP. In 2007, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizer like manure. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizer like manure

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
K. Manzura is 38 years old. She and her husband have been married for about twenty years and raised four wonderful children. Manzura has been running her own small business for thirteen years already. She has a store where she sells shampoos, detergents, toothpaste, brushes and other items. Manzura is very friendly and polite which brings her more customers. Now she is requesting a loan of 5000 TJS. Manzura is planning to use the loan to purchase more goods to sell, and to increase the variety of products. She promises to pay her loan and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
B. Nortoji is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Nortoji's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and family. That was why Nortoji decided to start her own business twenty-five years ago, selling fabrics for the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1400. With this money, Nortoji will be able to buy seasonal fabrics. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fabrics, increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a 23-year-old gentleman married to Christine Kazungu. They have a child by the name Sarah Zawadi. He and his family reside in Mtopanga, an estate within Mombasa. His business is in a busy residential area where he sells clothing materials, and he also does tailoring, mainly school uniforms. 

Mr. K. was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and he is happy to be associated with this name. He plans to purchase materials and sundries to facilitate the expansion of his business. 

Mr. K.'s future hopes are to venture into the business of supplying clothing materials and shifting from small scale tailoring. He would like to be a major brand tailor.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase materials and sundries

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik M. is an economist, and she lives in Ijevan with two sons and a daughter-in-law. Her older son graduated the Ijevan College and now helps Hasmik in her business. The younger one studies at the Yerevan Police Academy. Hasmik has her own business which she runs in her private shop where she sells food, flour and animal feed. From the income, Hasmik bought a small apartment for her family. She needs a loan of 500.000 AMD to buy fodder to sell. In the future Hasmik hopes to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy fodder to sell

loans.name: Haidarali

texts.en:
K. Haidarali is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. His mother and father are living with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses. He has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for nine years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with necessary food. Now Haidarali needs a loan of $1400. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Haidarali is counting on your help and support.
